original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa rnam par spangs pa'i phyir ro //

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /

original: ji ltar na nor pa dngos po dang dngos po med pa rnam par spangs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar na nor pa dngos po dang dngos po med pa rnam par spangs she na /

analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: byis pa thams cad kyi spyod yul sna tshogs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: ji ltar gangg'a'i klung de yi dvags rnams kyis mthong ba dang mi mthong ba'i phyir nor pa ni dngos po yod pa ma yin no //

analyzed: gzhan dag la snang bas na de'i phyir dngos po med pa'ang ma yin te /

analyzed: de ltar na nor pa ni 'phags pa rnams phyin ci log dang phyin ci log ma yin pa rnam par spangs pas de'i phyir nor pa ni rtag pa ste /
translated: Thus, error is permanent because the noble ones abandon error and non-error.

original: 'di lta @367a *//
analyzed: 'di lta @367a *//
translated: It is like this:

original: ste; mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid mi 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ste; mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid mi 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the characteristics of signs are indestructible.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /

original: nor pa ni mtshan ma sna tshogs ma yin te /
analyzed: nor pa ni mtshan ma sna tshogs ma yin te /

analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan ma 'jigs pas de'i phyir nor pa ni rtag pa'o //

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: ji ltar na nor pa de kho na yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na nor pa de kho na yin zhe na /
translated: how is that error reality?

original: gal te yang rgyu dang rkyen gyi nor pa 'di la 'phags pa rnams phyin ci log gi blo dang / phyin ci log ma yin pa'i blo'ang mi skye na'o //
analyzed: gal te yang rgyu dang rkyen gyi nor pa 'di la 'phags pa rnams phyin ci log gi blo dang / phyin ci log ma yin pa'i blo'ang mi skye na'o //
translated: If, moreover, in this error of causes and conditions, the noble ones do not give rise to the mind of error or the mind of non-error.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: 'phags pa rnams ma gtogs par nor pa 'di la cung zad tsam du 'du shes yod pa ni 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi dngos po'i mtshan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams ma gtogs par nor pa 'di la cung zad tsam du 'du shes yod pa ni 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi dngos po'i mtshan nyid ma yin no //
translated: except for the noble ones, in this error there is the perception of mere things, which is not the characteristic of the reality of the noble ones' wisdom.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: cung zad tsam zhes bya ba de ni byis pa rnams kyi rnam par brtags pas brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: cung zad tsam zhes bya ba de ni byis pa rnams kyi rnam par brtags pas brjod pa yin te /

analyzed: 'phags pas brjod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not said by the noble ones.

original: nor pa de'ang phyin ci log dang phyin ci log ma yin par rnam par brtags pas rigs rnam pa gnyis skyed de /
analyzed: nor pa de'ang phyin ci log dang phyin ci log ma yin par rnam par brtags pas rigs rnam pa gnyis skyed de /
translated: That error, moreover, generates two kinds of dispositions, depending on whether it is erroneous or not.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: 'phags pa'i rigs dang / byis pa so so'i skye bo'i rigs so //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i rigs dang / byis pa so so'i skye bo'i rigs so //
translated: the disposition of the āryas and the disposition of ordinary beings.

original: 'phags pa'i rigs kyang rnam pa gsum du dbye bas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i rigs kyang rnam pa gsum du dbye bas 'di lta ste /
translated: The disposition of the āryas is also divided into three:

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'o //
translated: the vehicle of the śrāvakas, the vehicle of the pratyekabuddhas, and the vehicle of the buddhas.

original: ji ltar na byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams rnam par brtags pas nyan thos kyi theg pa'i rigs skyed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams rnam par brtags pas nyan thos kyi theg pa'i rigs skyed ce na /
translated: How does the disposition of the vehicle of the śrāvakas arise from the error of ordinary beings?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la mngon @367b par zhe na pas nyan thos kyi rigs su 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la mngon @367b par zhe na pas nyan thos kyi rigs su 'gyur te /
translated: Through their strong attachment to the specific and general characteristics of phenomena, they become of the disposition of the śrāvakas.

original: de ltar na rnam par dag pas nyan thos kyi theg pa'i rigs skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par dag pas nyan thos kyi theg pa'i rigs skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the disposition of the vehicle of the śrāvakas arises from error.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: nor pa de nyid rnam par brtags pas rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i rigs skyed par byed de /
analyzed: nor pa de nyid rnam par brtags pas rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i rigs skyed par byed de /
translated: By investigating that error itself, the spiritual affinity for the Solitary Buddha Vehicle is generated.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: nor pa de nyid kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du sgom pa na mngon par zhen pa med pas rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i rigs skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: nor pa de nyid kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du sgom pa na mngon par zhen pa med pas rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i rigs skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: When one meditates on the characteristics of that error itself, whether general or particular, the spiritual affinity for the Solitary Buddha Vehicle is generated because of the absence of attachment.

original: ji ltar na mkhas pa rnams kyis nor pa de nyid la rnam par brtags pas sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i rigs skyed par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na mkhas pa rnams kyis nor pa de nyid la rnam par brtags pas sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i rigs skyed par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does the spiritual affinity for the Buddha Vehicle arise when the wise investigate that error itself?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: rang gi sems snang ba tsam du khong du chud pas phyi rol gyi dngos po dang / dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog na sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i rigs skyed par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba tsam du khong du chud pas phyi rol gyi dngos po dang / dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog na sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i rigs skyed par byed pa yin te /
translated: When one understands that the appearance of one's own mind is merely one's own mind, and one does not conceptualize external things as existent or non-existent, the spiritual affinity for the Buddha Vehicle is generated.

original: 'di ni nor pa de nyid las sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i rigs skyed par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nor pa de nyid las sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i rigs skyed par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the generation of the spiritual affinity for the Buddha Vehicle from that error itself.

original: gzhan yang dngos po sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin du nor pa la byis pa rnams kyis rnam par brtags pas na byis pa so so'i skye bo'i rigs skyed par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang dngos po sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin du nor pa la byis pa rnams kyis rnam par brtags pas na byis pa so so'i skye bo'i rigs skyed par byed de /
translated: Moreover, because childish beings imagine the error of the nature of various things, they produce the family of childish ordinary beings.

original: de ni dngos po'ang ma yin /
analyzed: de ni dngos po'ang ma yin /
translated: That is neither a thing

original: dngos po med pa'ang ma yin pa ni rigs kyi don ces bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'ang ma yin pa ni rigs kyi don ces bya'o //
translated: nor a non-thing. This is called the meaning of the family.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: nor pa de nyid la rnam par mi rtog pas 'phags pa rnams sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa las 'das pa'i phyir bag chags kyi rang bzhin gyi chos la gzhan du gyur pa'i @368a *//
analyzed: nor pa de nyid la rnam par mi rtog pas 'phags pa rnams sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa las 'das pa'i phyir bag chags kyi rang bzhin gyi chos la gzhan du gyur pa'i @368a *//
translated: because the noble ones do not conceptualize that very error, they transcend mind, mentality, and mental consciousness. Therefore, the transformation of the phenomena that are the nature of habitual tendencies

original: dngos po ni de bzhin nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po ni de bzhin nyid ces bya ste /
translated: is called suchness.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin nyid ni sems las grol ba'o zhes tshig 'di ngas smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin nyid ni sems las grol ba'o zhes tshig 'di ngas smras te /
translated: Therefore, I have said these words: 'Suchness is liberated from mind.'

original: mtshan ma rnam par spangs pa bstan pa'i phyir mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'o zhes smras pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma rnam par spangs pa bstan pa'i phyir mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'o zhes smras pa yin no //
translated: In order to teach the abandonment of signs, I have said, 'It is free from all signs.'

original: blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
analyzed: blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
translated: The greatly wise one requested the Bhagavān:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavān,

original: nor pa mchis pa'am; ma mchis pa zhig lags /
analyzed: nor pa mchis pa'am; ma mchis pa zhig lags /
translated: is there error or not?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said:

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: “Mahāmati,

original: ji ltar sgyu ma bzhin du mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid med de /
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma bzhin du mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid med de /
translated: like an illusion, there is no characteristic of clinging.

original: gal te nor pa la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid yod na ni mngon par zhen pa'i dngos po zlog par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te nor pa la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid yod na ni mngon par zhen pa'i dngos po zlog par mi 'gyur la /
translated: If the characteristic of clinging to error existed, then the entity of clinging would not be reversed,

analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'di yang mu stegs can gyi rgyu las skye ba bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: and this dependent origination would be like the arising from a cause of the tīrthikas.”

original: blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba /
analyzed: blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba /
translated: The greatly wise one requested the Bhagavān:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavān,

analyzed: gal te nor pa de sgyu ma dang mtshungs pa zhig lags na ni de ltar na nyon mongs pa gzhan gyi rgyu bgyid par 'gyur ro //

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said:

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: “Mahāmati,

original: sgyu ma ni nor pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: sgyu ma ni nor pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: an illusion is not the cause of error.

original: gnas ngan len gyi nyes pa mi skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi nyes pa mi skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not produce the faults of negative propensities.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: sgyu ma ni gnas ngan len gyi nyes pa mi skyed de /
analyzed: sgyu ma ni gnas ngan len gyi nyes pa mi skyed de /
translated: an illusion does not produce the faults of negative propensities,

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is non-conceptual.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

analyzed: sgyu ma ni gzhan @368b gyi rig sngags kyi mthu las 'byung gi /

analyzed: rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i gnas ngan len gyi bag chags las skyes pa ma yin pas de'i phyir nyes pa skyed pa byed pa ma yin no //
translated: but it is not produced from one's own conceptual negative propensities, and therefore it does not produce faults.

analyzed: blo gros chen po; byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi nor pa'i sems kyi mngon par zhen pa yin gyi 'phags pa rnams ni ma yin no //
translated: Mahāmati, it is the mistaken mind of attachment of foolish ordinary beings, not of the noble ones.

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid yang bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di gsungs so //

analyzed: 'phags pas nor pa mi mthong ste //

analyzed: dbus na'ang yang dag yod ma yin //

original: gal te dbus de yang dag na /
analyzed: gal te dbus de yang dag na /

analyzed: nor pa'ang yang dag nyid du 'gyur // nor pa thams cad spangs nas kyang //
translated: And error would become reality.🔽Even if you were to generate a sign

original: gal te mtshan ma yang skyed na //
analyzed: gal te mtshan ma yang skyed na //
translated: After abandoning all error,

original: de nyid kyang ni nor pa ste //
analyzed: de nyid kyang ni nor pa ste //
translated: That itself would be error,

original: rab rib yongs su ma dag bzhin //
analyzed: rab rib yongs su ma dag bzhin //
translated: Like the complete absence of visual distortion.

analyzed: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po; sgyu ma ma yin pa chos dang mtshungs pa yod pa ma yin pas chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur mthong ngo //
translated: Moreover, Mahamati, since there is no existence that is equivalent to a non-illusion, all phenomena are seen to be like illusions.

original: bcom ldan 'das la blo gros chen pos gsol pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la blo gros chen pos gsol pa /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni sgyu ma sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid la mngon par zhen pas chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu lags sam /
translated: Blessed One, are all phenomena like illusions because of the Blessed One's attachment to the characteristics of various illusions?

translated: Or is it because of attachment to the characteristics of distinctions? If all things are like illusions because of attachment to the characteristics of various illusions,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: dngos po rnams sgyu ma lta bu lags par @369a *//
analyzed: dngos po rnams sgyu ma lta bu lags par @369a *//
translated: Things would be like illusions.

original: 'gyur ro // de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar gzugs sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid ni rgyu ma mchis pa ma lags la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid ni rgyu ma mchis pa ma lags la /
translated: Because the characteristics of various forms are not without causes.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: rgyu gang yang gzugs sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid sgyu ma lta bur snang bar bgyid pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: rgyu gang yang gzugs sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid sgyu ma lta bur snang bar bgyid pa ma mchis so //
translated: there is no cause whatsoever that makes the characteristics of various forms appear like illusions.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de'i slad du sgyu ma sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid la mngon par zhen pa dang chos mthun pa ma mchis pas dngos po rnams sgyu ma lta bu ma lags so //
analyzed: de'i slad du sgyu ma sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid la mngon par zhen pa dang chos mthun pa ma mchis pas dngos po rnams sgyu ma lta bu ma lags so //

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: “Mahāmati,

analyzed: sgyu ma sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid la mngon par zhen pa dang chos mthun pas chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu ma yin mod kyi /
translated: things are not like illusions because of similarity with attachment to the characteristics of various illusions.

original: 'on kyang / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: 'on kyang / blo gros chen po /
translated: However, Mahāmati,

original: chos thams cad ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni yang dag pa ma yin te /

analyzed: myur du 'jug pa glog dang 'dra bas na sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya'o //
translated: It is like a flash of lightning, and so it is said to be like an illusion.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: dper na / glog 'gyur ba skad cig tu 'byung la /
analyzed: dper na / glog 'gyur ba skad cig tu 'byung la /
translated: for example, lightning appears in an instant and then disappears,

original: byung nas 'jig pa ni byis ba so so'i skye bo rnams la mi snang ste /
analyzed: byung nas 'jig pa ni byis ba so so'i skye bo rnams la mi snang ste /
translated: and does not appear to ordinary, foolish people.

original: de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la dngos po med par rab tu rnam par 'byed pa med pa dang / gzugs kyi mtshan nyid la mngon par ma chags pa med pa las snang ngo //

translated: In the same way, all phenomena appear from the absence of differentiation of the specific and general characteristics of one's own conceptual thoughts, and from the absence of attachment to the characteristics of form.

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid yang bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di gsungs so //

original: dngos po rnams ni sgyu mar brjod //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni sgyu mar brjod //
translated: things are said to be like an illusion.

original: yang dag ma yin glog 'dra bas //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin glog 'dra bas //
translated: Not real, like a flash of lightning,

original: de phyir sgyu ma lta bur bshad //
analyzed: de phyir sgyu ma lta bur bshad //
translated: therefore, they are explained to be like an illusion.

original: blo gros chen pos yang bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba /
analyzed: blo gros chen pos yang bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba /

translated: Because of the characteristics of mutual movement, and because the elements and forms are not accumulations, and because the view of the transitory collection is abandoned by the stream-enterer when examining the positions of existence and non-existence.

analyzed: bud med la sred cing 'dod pa dang / mngon par chags shing zhen pa'i thabs rnam pa sna tshogs las byung ba /

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa rtogs par bya ba'i 'dod chags spangs pa ni ma yin no //

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid cig snang zhing rnam par rtog pa skye ba'i mtshan nyid du mthong ba'i mtshan nyid mi skye ba dang / bsam gtan gyi mtshan nyid rab tu mthong ba'i phyir 'jig rten 'dir 'ongs nas cig car sdug bsngal mthar byas te mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par byed pas de'i phyir lan gcig phyir 'ong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid cig snang zhing rnam par rtog pa skye ba'i mtshan nyid du mthong ba'i mtshan nyid mi skye ba dang / bsam gtan gyi mtshan nyid rab tu mthong ba'i phyir 'jig rten 'dir 'ongs nas cig car sdug bsngal mthar byas te mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par byed pas de'i phyir lan gcig phyir 'ong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The characteristic of form is seen to be unborn, and the characteristic of the arising of conceptualization is not seen. Because the characteristic of meditative concentration is well seen, having come to this world, they immediately put an end to suffering and attain nirvāṇa. Therefore, they are called “once-returners.”

original: blo gros chen po; ji ltar na phyir mi 'ong ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: blo gros chen po; ji ltar na phyir mi 'ong ba yin zhe na /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i gzugs kyi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po rnams dngos po med pa dang / lta ba'i nyes pa skyes pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi skye ba'i phyir dang / kun tu sbyor ba spangs pa'i phyir phyir mi 'ong ba zhes bya'o //

translated: The entities of the characteristics of form in the past, future, and present are non-existent, and because the conceptualization of afflictions born from the faults of views does not arise, and because of abandoning the fetters, they are called “non-returners.”

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /

original: dgra bcom pa ni 'di lta ste /

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ltar yang dag par rab tu rtog ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ltar yang dag par rab tu rtog ste /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva should investigate this as follows:

original: de don dam pa'i bden par ni 'byung ba chen po dag skye ba med do //
analyzed: de don dam pa'i bden par ni 'byung ba chen po dag skye ba med do //
translated: In the ultimate truth, the great elements do not arise.

original: 'byung ba chen po dag la skye ba med par de ltar rab tu rtog par byed de /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po dag la skye ba med par de ltar rab tu rtog par byed de /
translated: He should investigate the great elements in this way, as non-arising.

original: de ltar rab tu brtags nas ming dang rgyu mtshan rnams ni rnam par rtog pa tsam dang / rang gi sems snang ba tsam dang / phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams dngos po med par rtogs pa ni rang gi sems snang ba rnam par rtog pa tsam zhes bya'o; ;'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ltar rab tu brtags nas ming dang rgyu mtshan rnams ni rnam par rtog pa tsam dang / rang gi sems snang ba tsam dang / phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams dngos po med par rtogs pa ni rang gi sems snang ba rnam par rtog pa tsam zhes bya'o; ;'di lta ste /
translated: Having investigated in this way, he understands that names and characteristics are mere conceptualization, mere appearances of his own mind, and external things are non-existent. This is called 'mere conceptualization of his own mind's appearances'.

original: khams gsum pa'i 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa de dag la rab tu brtags na /
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa de dag la rab tu brtags na /
translated: Thus, when he investigates the elements and derivatives of the three realms,

original: ngo bo nyid kyis mtha' bzhi dang bral bas tshul rnam par dag pa bdag dang bdag gi bral ba /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis mtha' bzhi dang bral bas tshul rnam par dag pa bdag dang bdag gi bral ba /
translated: he realizes that they are free from the four extremes by their very essence, and thus the pure mode is free from self and 'mine'.

original: yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dbyibs su gnas pa /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dbyibs su gnas pa /
translated: The characteristics of reality are present in the shape of their own characteristics.

original: ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid du 'grub par mthong ngo //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid du 'grub par mthong ngo //
translated: They are seen to be established as the characteristic of non-arising.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: ji ltar na 'byung ba chen po bzhi po de dag gis rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams skyed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'byung ba chen po bzhi po de dag gis rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams skyed ce na /
translated: how do the four great elements produce the forms that are their effects?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: gsher bar rnam par rtog pa'i 'byung ba chen pos ni phyi nang gi chu'i khams skyed do /
analyzed: gsher bar rnam par rtog pa'i 'byung ba chen pos ni phyi nang gi chu'i khams skyed do /
translated: The great element that conceptualizes fluidity produces the inner and outer water element.

original: bya ba nus pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i 'byung ba chen pos ni phyi nang gi me'i khams skyed do //
analyzed: bya ba nus pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i 'byung ba chen pos ni phyi nang gi me'i khams skyed do //
translated: The great element that conceptualizes the ability to perform functions produces the inner and outer fire element.

original: g-yo bar rnam par rtog pa'i 'byung ba chen pos ni @378b phyi nang gi rlung gi khams skyed do //
analyzed: g-yo bar rnam par rtog pa'i 'byung ba chen pos ni @378b phyi nang gi rlung gi khams skyed do //
translated: The great element that conceptualizes movement produces the inner and outer wind element.

original: gzugs gcad du rung bar rnam par rtog pa'i 'byung ba chen pos ni phyi nang gi sa'i khams skyed do;/
analyzed: gzugs gcad du rung bar rnam par rtog pa'i 'byung ba chen pos ni phyi nang gi sa'i khams skyed do;/
translated: The great element that conceptualizes form as divisible produces the inner and outer earth element.

original: gzugs dang nam mkha' gnyis ka'ang log pa'i bden pa la mngon par zhen pas phung po lnga 'dus pa dang / 'byung ba chen po dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa skye'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang nam mkha' gnyis ka'ang log pa'i bden pa la mngon par zhen pas phung po lnga 'dus pa dang / 'byung ba chen po dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa skye'o //
translated: Both form and space are the result of attachment to the truth of falsity, and so the five aggregates, the great elements, and the elements derived from the great elements arise.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: rnam par shes pa ni gnas rnam pa sna tshogs dang / yul la mngon par chags pa'i rgyus 'gro ba gzhan du mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni gnas rnam pa sna tshogs dang / yul la mngon par chags pa'i rgyus 'gro ba gzhan du mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: consciousness is connected to other transmigrations due to the cause of attachment to various abodes and objects.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: sa la sogs pa chen po bzhi dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams la ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rten yod kyi /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa chen po bzhi dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams la ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rten yod kyi /
translated: the four great elements such as earth and the elements derived from the great elements have a basis in the four great elements,

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag gi rkyen ni ma yin no /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag gi rkyen ni ma yin no /
translated: but the four great elements are not conditions for the four great elements.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dngos po dang / dbyibs dang; mtshan nyid dang / gnas dang / bya ba dang / sbyor ba rnams dngos po med pas 'byung ba chen po rnams mi skye'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang / dbyibs dang; mtshan nyid dang / gnas dang / bya ba dang / sbyor ba rnams dngos po med pas 'byung ba chen po rnams mi skye'o //
translated: since things, shapes, characteristics, abodes, actions, and applications are non-existent, the great elements do not arise.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: dngos po dang / dbyibs dang / mtshan nyid dang / gnas dang / bya ba dang / sbyor ba rnams 'dus pa las skye bas /🔽dbyibs med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po dang / dbyibs dang / mtshan nyid dang / gnas dang / bya ba dang / sbyor ba rnams 'dus pa las skye bas / dbyibs med pa ma yin no //
translated: because they arise from the aggregation of things, shapes, characteristics, locations, actions, and applications.🔽Therefore, they are not without shape.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Thus,

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: 'byung ba chen po dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i mtshan nyid ni mu stegs can rnams kyis rnam par brtags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i mtshan nyid ni mu stegs can rnams kyis rnam par brtags pa yin gyi /
translated: the characteristics of the great elements and the derivative elements are imagined by the tīrthikas,

original: ngas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ngas ni ma yin no //
translated: but not by me.

original: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /🔽phung po rnams kyi rang @379a *//
analyzed: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po / phung po rnams kyi rang @379a *//
translated: Moreover, Mahāmati,

original: gi ngo bo'i mtshan nyid rab tu bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: gi ngo bo'i mtshan nyid rab tu bstan par bya'o //
translated: I will teach the characteristics of the individual essences of the aggregates.

original: phung po rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo'i mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: phung po rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo'i mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What are the characteristics of the individual essences of the aggregates?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: phung po lnga rnams so //
analyzed: phung po lnga rnams so //
translated: There are five aggregates.

original: phung po lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: phung po lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five aggregates?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rnams so //
translated: form, feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness.

original: de la phung po bzhi rnams ni gzugs med de; tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: de la phung po bzhi rnams ni gzugs med de; tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rnams so //
translated: The four aggregates are formless: feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: gzugs ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa phan tshun du mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa phan tshun du mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: form is the four great elements and what is derived from the four great elements, with the characteristics of mutual incompatibility.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: gzugs med pa la bzhir bgrang du med de /
analyzed: gzugs med pa la bzhir bgrang du med de /
translated: the formless cannot be counted as four,

original: nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: like space.

original: dper na / nam mkha' ni grangs kyi mtshan nyid las 'das te /
analyzed: dper na / nam mkha' ni grangs kyi mtshan nyid las 'das te /
translated: For example, space transcends the characteristics of number,

original: bgrang ba dang bral mod kyi /
analyzed: bgrang ba dang bral mod kyi /
translated: being free from enumeration.

original: rnam par rtog pas nam mkha' zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas nam mkha' zhes brjod do //
translated: Yet due to conceptualization, it is called “space.”

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: de bzhin du phung po rnams kyang grangs kyi mtshan nyid las 'das te /
analyzed: de bzhin du phung po rnams kyang grangs kyi mtshan nyid las 'das te /
translated: in the same way, the aggregates transcend the characteristics of number,

original: bgrang ba dang bral bas dngos po dang / dngos po med pa rnam par spangs pa /
analyzed: bgrang ba dang bral bas dngos po dang / dngos po med pa rnam par spangs pa /
translated: being free from enumeration, abandoned as both existent and nonexistent,

original: mtha' bzhi dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: mtha' bzhi dang bral ba'o //
translated: free from the four extremes.

original: grangs dang / bgrang ba'i mtshan nyid ni byis pas rab tu brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: grangs dang / bgrang ba'i mtshan nyid ni byis pas rab tu brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: The characteristics of enumeration and counting are taught by the childish,

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: but not by the noble ones.

original: blo gros chen pos /
analyzed: blo gros chen pos /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis ni sgyu ma lta bur gzugs rnam pa sna @379b tshogs gcig pa dang / tha dad pa rnam par spangs par nye bar 'dogs so //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis ni sgyu ma lta bur gzugs rnam pa sna @379b tshogs gcig pa dang / tha dad pa rnam par spangs par nye bar 'dogs so //
translated: the noble ones designate forms as being like illusions, free from the distinctions of being the same or different.

original: yang rmi lam dang / gzugs brnyan gyi skyes bu ltar gcig pa dang / tha dad pa rnam par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang rmi lam dang / gzugs brnyan gyi skyes bu ltar gcig pa dang / tha dad pa rnam par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, like a person in a dream or a reflection, they are free from the distinctions of being the same or different.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi tshul ni phung po dang 'dra bar rtog pas snang ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi tshul ni phung po dang 'dra bar rtog pas snang ngo //
translated: the way of the wisdom of the noble ones appears as the aggregates due to conceptualization.

original: de ni phung po rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de ni phung po rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: That is the characteristic of the nature of the aggregates.

original: khyod kyis bzlog par bya'o //
analyzed: khyod kyis bzlog par bya'o //
translated: You should turn away from that.

original: rnam par bzlog nas rab tu dben pa'i chos bstan pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du mu stegs can gyi lta ba rnams bzlog par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par bzlog nas rab tu dben pa'i chos bstan pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du mu stegs can gyi lta ba rnams bzlog par bya'o //
translated: Having turned away, by teaching the Dharma of complete seclusion, you should turn away from the views of the tīrthikas in all buddha-fields.

original: blo gros chen po; rab tu dben pa'i chos bstan pa'i tshe chos bdag med pa mthong ba rnam par dag par 'gyur /
analyzed: blo gros chen po; rab tu dben pa'i chos bstan pa'i tshe chos bdag med pa mthong ba rnam par dag par 'gyur /
translated: Mahāmati, when the teaching of the Dharma of complete seclusion is given, the vision of the selflessness of phenomena becomes pure.

original: mi g-yo ba'i sa la'ang rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i sa la'ang rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: One enters the stage of immovability.

original: de mi g-yo ba'i sar rab tu zhugs nas /
analyzed: de mi g-yo ba'i sar rab tu zhugs nas /
translated: Having entered the stage of immovability,

original: ting nge 'dzin tshad med pa la dbang byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin tshad med pa la dbang byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: one gains mastery over immeasurable meditative absorptions.

original: yid kyi lus thob pas sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu 'thob bo //
analyzed: yid kyi lus thob pas sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu 'thob bo //
translated: Having attained a mental body, one gains the meditative absorption that is like an illusion.

original: stobs dang / mngon par shes pa dang / dbang rnams rtogs par khong du chud pas sems can thams cad sdud cing phan 'dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stobs dang / mngon par shes pa dang / dbang rnams rtogs par khong du chud pas sems can thams cad sdud cing phan 'dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By realizing the powers, superknowledges, and masteries, one gathers and benefits all sentient beings.

original: dper na / sa chen po ni sems can rnams 'degs shing phan 'dogs par byed pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs pa yin no /🔽gzhan yang / blo @380a *//
analyzed: dper na / sa chen po ni sems can rnams 'degs shing phan 'dogs par byed pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs pa yin no / gzhan yang / blo @380a *//
translated: Just as the great earth supports and benefits sentient beings, so too the bodhisattva mahāsattva benefits all sentient beings.

original: gros chen po /
analyzed: gros chen po /
translated: Moreover, Mahāmati,

original: mu stegs can rnams la mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: mu stegs can rnams la mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa bzhi yod de /
translated: The tīrthikas have four kinds of nirvāṇa.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin dngos po med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang / mtshan nyid sna tshogs kyi dngos po dngos po med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin dngos po med par rtogs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin dngos po med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang / mtshan nyid sna tshogs kyi dngos po dngos po med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin dngos po med par rtogs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang /
translated: the nirvāṇa of the nonexistence of things that have the nature of things, the nirvāṇa of the nonexistence of things that have the nature of various characteristics, the nirvāṇa of the realization that the nature of one’s own characteristics is nonexistent,

original: phung po rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyud kyi rgyun chad pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: phung po rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyud kyi rgyun chad pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: and the nirvāṇa of the cessation of the continuum of the general and specific characteristics of the aggregates.

original: de dag ni mu stegs can rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni mu stegs can rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa yin te /
translated: Those are the nirvāṇas of the tīrthikas,

original: nga'i gsung rab la ma yin no //
analyzed: nga'i gsung rab la ma yin no //
translated: not of my scriptures.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: nga'i gsung rab la ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa bzlog pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nga'i gsung rab la ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa bzlog pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: in my scriptures, the reversal of the conceptual consciousness is called nirvāṇa.

original: blo gros chen pos gsol pa /
analyzed: blo gros chen pos gsol pa /
translated: Mahāmati said:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par shes pa brgyad du rnam par ma bzhag pa lags sam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par shes pa brgyad du rnam par ma bzhag pa lags sam /
translated: “Have the eight consciousnesses not been taught by the Bhagavān?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān replied:

original: rnam par bzhag go /
analyzed: rnam par bzhag go /
translated: “They have been taught.”

original: blo gros chen pos gsol pa /
analyzed: blo gros chen pos gsol pa /
translated: Mahāmati said:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavān,

original: gal te rnam par bzhag na ji ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pa log pas gsal /
analyzed: gal te rnam par bzhag na ji ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pa log pas gsal /
translated: if they have been taught, then why is it that the mental consciousness is clear when it is reversed,

original: rnam par shes pa bdun rnams ni ma lags /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bdun rnams ni ma lags /
translated: but not the seven consciousnesses?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis blo gros chen po la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis blo gros chen po la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said to Mahāmati:

original: de dag gi rgyu @380b dang; de dag gis dmigs pa rkyen yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa bdun rnams 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu @380b dang; de dag gis dmigs pa rkyen yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa bdun rnams 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: “Because their causes and their objective conditions are not present, the seven consciousnesses do not arise.

original: de la yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni yul rnams bye brag 'byed cing mngon par zhen pas bag chags rnams bskyed nas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rgyas par byed de /
analyzed: de la yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni yul rnams bye brag 'byed cing mngon par zhen pas bag chags rnams bskyed nas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rgyas par byed de /
translated: Among them, the mental consciousness, having generated the habitual tendencies by distinguishing and fixating on objects, causes the ālaya consciousness to increase.

original: yid dang lhan cig tu bdag dang bdag gis 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen cing /
analyzed: yid dang lhan cig tu bdag dang bdag gis 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen cing /
translated: Together with the mind, it fixates on the grasping of ‘I’ and ‘mine.’

original: ngar sems pa'i rkyen gyis skye bas lus kyi mtshan nyid rnam par mi 'jig go /
analyzed: ngar sems pa'i rkyen gyis skye bas lus kyi mtshan nyid rnam par mi 'jig go /
translated: Since it arises due to the condition of the mind, the characteristics of the body are not destroyed.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyur gyur cing de la dmigs pa rang gi sems snang ba'i yul la mngon par zhen pas sems 'dus pa gcig gi rgyur gcig 'byung ste /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyur gyur cing de la dmigs pa rang gi sems snang ba'i yul la mngon par zhen pas sems 'dus pa gcig gi rgyur gcig 'byung ste /
translated: The mind is the cause of the consciousness of the ground of all, and it is the cause of the arising of the single consciousness that is the object of one’s own mind appearing as the object of observation.

original: dper na / rgya mtsho'i rlabs lta bur rang gi snang ba'i spyod yul gyi rlung gis bskyod pas 'jug cing log pa'ang de bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na / rgya mtsho'i rlabs lta bur rang gi snang ba'i spyod yul gyi rlung gis bskyod pas 'jug cing log pa'ang de bzhin te /
translated: For example, just as the ocean is moved by the wind that is the object of its own appearance, it moves and returns in the same way.

original: de lta bas na yid kyi rnam par shes pa bzlog pas rnam par shes pa bdun rnams kyang ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na yid kyi rnam par shes pa bzlog pas rnam par shes pa bdun rnams kyang ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, by reversing the mental consciousness, the seven consciousnesses are also reversed.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid yang bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid yang bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
translated: Then, the Bhagavān, in order to teach just that meaning, spoke these verses:

original: bya ba dang ni mtshan nyid dang // dngos por mya ngan dang mi 'da'//
analyzed: bya ba dang ni mtshan nyid dang // dngos por mya ngan dang mi 'da'//
translated: “The activity, the characteristic, and the entity do not pass into nirvāṇa.

original: rnam rtog ces bya rnam shes te //
analyzed: rnam rtog ces bya rnam shes te //
translated: What is called ‘conceptuality’ is consciousness.

original: bzlog pas mya ngan nga 'das so //
analyzed: bzlog pas mya ngan nga 'das so //
translated: By reversing it, I have passed into nirvāṇa.”

analyzed: de bzhin du 'tshal lo zhes bka' mnyan pa dang / de la bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Bhagavān said this to him:

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: “Mahāmati,

analyzed: yid las byung ba'i lus ni rnam pa gsum ste /

analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /

analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba la snyoms par zhugs pa'i yid las byung ba'i lus dang / chos kyi ngo bo nyid rtog pa'i yid las byung ba'i lus dang / ris su lhan cig skyes pa mngon par 'du bya ba med pas yid las byung ba'i lus te /
translated: the mental body that enters into the bliss of samādhi, the mental body that conceives the nature of phenomena, and the mental body that is spontaneously born without being created by the class.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis sa dang po nas gong nas gong du sa'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes pas lus rnam pa gsum po 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis sa dang po nas gong nas gong du sa'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes pas lus rnam pa gsum po 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The yogis and yoginis, by fully understanding the characteristics of the grounds from the first ground onward, will attain the three kinds of bodies.

original: de la / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: de la / blo gros chen po /

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba la snyoms par zhugs pa'i yid las byung ba'i lus gang zhe na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba la snyoms par zhugs pa'i yid las byung ba'i lus gang zhe na /
translated: what is the body that arises from the mind, which is absorbed in the bliss of samadhi?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: sa gsum pa dang / bzhi pa dang / lnga pa la ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba la snyoms par zhugs pa'i phyir rang gi sems rnam pa mang po dpen par spyod pas sems kyi rgya mtsho la gnas te /
analyzed: sa gsum pa dang / bzhi pa dang / lnga pa la ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba la snyoms par zhugs pa'i phyir rang gi sems rnam pa mang po dpen par spyod pas sems kyi rgya mtsho la gnas te /
translated: Because of being absorbed in the bliss of samadhi on the third, fourth, and fifth grounds, by engaging in the many aspects of one's own mind, one abides in the ocean of mind.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rlabs kyis mtshan nyid mi 'byung bas rang gi sems snang ba'i yul dngos po yod pa dang / dngos po med pa yongs su shes pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi @387b bde ba la snyoms par zhugs pa'i yid las byung ba'i lus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rlabs kyis mtshan nyid mi 'byung bas rang gi sems snang ba'i yul dngos po yod pa dang / dngos po med pa yongs su shes pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi @387b bde ba la snyoms par zhugs pa'i yid las byung ba'i lus zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the waves of consciousness do not arise due to characteristics, fully understanding the existent and nonexistent objects that appear to one's own mind is called the body that arises from the mind, which is absorbed in the bliss of samadhi.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahamati,

original: chos kyi ngo bo nyid rtogs pa'i yid las byung ba'i lus gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos kyi ngo bo nyid rtogs pa'i yid las byung ba'i lus gang zhe na /
translated: What is the body that arises from the mind that realizes the nature of phenomena?

original: 'di lta ste; sa brgyad pa la sgyu ma lta bu la sogs pa'i chos la snang ba med par rnam par khong du chud pas lus dang sems gnas shin tu gyur te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste; sa brgyad pa la sgyu ma lta bu la sogs pa'i chos la snang ba med par rnam par khong du chud pas lus dang sems gnas shin tu gyur te /
translated: It is as follows: On the eighth ground, due to the realization of the non-appearance of phenomena such as illusions, the body and mind undergo a complete transformation.

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu 'thob pa dang / gzhan yang ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo dang / mtshan ma dang / stobs dang / dbang dang / mngon par shes pa dpag tu med pa 'thob ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu 'thob pa dang / gzhan yang ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo dang / mtshan ma dang / stobs dang / dbang dang / mngon par shes pa dpag tu med pa 'thob ste /
translated: One attains the absorption of illusion-like samādhi, and also attains immeasurable gateways of samādhi, signs, powers, controls, and superknowledges.

original: me tog ltar rgyas shing yid bzhin du mgyogs pa dang / sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / chu zla dang / gzugs brnyan lta bu 'byung ba las gyur pa ma yin yang 'byung ba las gyur pa dang 'dra ba /
analyzed: me tog ltar rgyas shing yid bzhin du mgyogs pa dang / sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / chu zla dang / gzugs brnyan lta bu 'byung ba las gyur pa ma yin yang 'byung ba las gyur pa dang 'dra ba /
translated: Although it does not arise from the elements, it is like something arisen from the elements, like a blooming flower, swift as one wishes, and like an illusion, a dream, the reflection of the moon in water, and a reflection.

original: gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs thams cad kyis yan lag phun sum tshogs par brgyan pa /
analyzed: gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs thams cad kyis yan lag phun sum tshogs par brgyan pa /

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyi rjes su 'jug pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyi rjes su 'jug pa /
translated: It is to enter the maṇḍala of the retinue in all buddha realms.

original: chos kyi ngo bo nyid rtogs par khong du chud pa'i phyir de ni chos kyi ngo bo nyid rtogs pa las byung ba'i lus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi ngo bo nyid rtogs par khong du chud pa'i phyir de ni chos kyi ngo bo nyid rtogs pa las byung ba'i lus zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it realizes the nature of phenomena, it is called the body that arises from the realization of the nature of phenomena.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: de la ris su lhan cig skyes pa mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i yid las byung ba'i lus gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ris su lhan cig skyes pa mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i yid las byung ba'i lus gang zhe na /
translated: what is the body that arises from the mind, which is innate and non-composite?

original: 'di lta ste /🔽sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rtogs shing rang gis thob pa'i bde ba'i @388a *//
analyzed: 'di lta ste / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rtogs shing rang gis thob pa'i bde ba'i @388a *//
translated: It is as follows:

original: mtshan nyid la dmigs pa de ni ris su lhan cig skyes pa mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i yid las byung ba'i lus zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid la dmigs pa de ni ris su lhan cig skyes pa mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i yid las byung ba'i lus zhes bya ste /
translated: The observation of the characteristics of one's own attained bliss through realizing all the qualities of a buddha is called the body that arises from the mind, which is innate and non-composite.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

analyzed: lus gsum po de dag gis mtshan nyid rab tu dbye ba rtogs pa 'di la rab tu brtson par bya'o //

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
translated: Then, the Bhagavān, in order to perfectly teach just that meaning, spoke these verses:

original: nga yis theg pa theg chen min //
analyzed: nga yis theg pa theg chen min //

original: bshad pa med cing yi ge med //
analyzed: bshad pa med cing yi ge med //
translated: It is not explained and has no letters.🔽It is not true and is not liberation,

analyzed: bden pa ma yin rnam grol min; ;spyod yul med pa'ang ma yin te /

original: 'on kyang theg chen theg pa ni //
analyzed: 'on kyang theg chen theg pa ni //
translated: However, the Mahāyāna vehicle

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Bhagavān, as you have said, ‘son of a good family,

translated: In order that sons and daughters of good family who have committed the five acts of immediate retribution will not fall into the Avici hell, and in order to generate enthusiasm, he teaches the realization of emanations through his blessing.

analyzed: mtshams med pa'i dngos po byas pa rnams mngon par rtog @388b pa mi 'thob par gcig tu nges pa'ang med de /

analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba tsam du khong du chud pa dang / lus dang longs spyod du rnam par rtog ba dang / bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa dang bral ba dang / gal te brgya lam na dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad nas 'gro ba gzhan du mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par rtog pa las grol bar 'gyur ba ni ma gtogs so //
translated: because they understand that they are merely appearances of their own minds, because they are free from the conceptualization of body and possessions, and from the grasping of “I” and “mine,” except when they are liberated from the conceptualization of rebirth in other realms after meeting a spiritual friend, even if it is only for a moment.

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid yang bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
translated: verses:

analyzed: 'dod pa'i srid pa ma zhes bya //

analyzed: ma rig pa ni pha yin no //

original: yul rig rnam shes sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: yul rig rnam shes sangs rgyas te /

original: bag la nyal ni dgra bcom pa //
analyzed: bag la nyal ni dgra bcom pa //

original: phung po 'dus pa dge 'dun yin //
analyzed: phung po 'dus pa dge 'dun yin //

analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to; ;bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sangs rgyas pa nyid bdag la bka' stsal du gsol /
translated: please tell me about the buddhahood of the buddhas.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: ji ltar na sangs rgyas rnams kyi sangs rgyas pa nyid lags /
translated: how is it the buddhahood of the buddhas?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: “Mahāmati,

original: gang zag dang chos la bdag med par rtogs pa dang / sgrib @389a *//
analyzed: gang zag dang chos la bdag med par rtogs pa dang / sgrib @389a *//
translated: The realization of the selflessness of persons and phenomena,🔽the thorough understanding and comprehension of the two obscurations,

analyzed: pa gnyis yongs su shes shing khong du chud pa dang / shi 'pho rnam pa gnyis dang bral ba dang / nyon mongs pa rnam pa gnyig spangs pa de ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi sangs rgyas pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: the freedom from the two kinds of death, and the abandonment of the two kinds of afflictions—this is called the buddhahood of the buddhas.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos de dag nyid khong du chud na de'ang sangs rgyas pa nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos de dag nyid khong du chud na de'ang sangs rgyas pa nyid ces bya ste /

analyzed: des na de'i phyir ngas theg pa gcig tu bshad do //
translated: Therefore, I have explained the one vehicle.

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid yang bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di gsungs so //

analyzed: bdag med rnam gnyis mkhas pa dang;/ sgrib gnyis nyon mongs rab spangs dang // shi 'pho gnyis dang gtan bral ba //
translated: the freedom from the two kinds of death,

original: de ni sangs rgyas nyid ces bya //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas nyid ces bya //
translated: that is called buddhahood.”

original: de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //

translated: “Why is it that the Bhagavān, in the midst of the assembly, has said, ‘I am all the buddhas of the past’?

original: skyes pa'i rabs sna tshogs su'ang nga nyid de'i tshe 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i spyi bo skyes dang / glang po che so drug pa dang / ne tso dang / dbang po dang / drang srong mig bzang la sogs pa'o zhes skyes pa'i @389b rabs brgya stong gsungs /
analyzed: skyes pa'i rabs sna tshogs su'ang nga nyid de'i tshe 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i spyi bo skyes dang / glang po che so drug pa dang / ne tso dang / dbang po dang / drang srong mig bzang la sogs pa'o zhes skyes pa'i @389b rabs brgya stong gsungs /
translated: In the various jātakas, he has also said, ‘At that time, I was the head-born cakravartin king, the sixty-tusked elephant, the parrot, Indra, the sage Sunetra, and so on.’

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān replied:

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: “Mahāmati,

translated: “Because of four kinds of sameness, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One says to the assembly, ‘I was the Buddha Vipaśyin at that time, at that epoch,’ and so on up to ‘I was the Buddha Kāśyapa at that time, at that epoch.’

original: mtshungs pa rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: mtshungs pa rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four kinds of sameness?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: yi ge mtshungs pa dang / gsung mtshungs pa dang / chos mtshungs pa dang / sku mtshungs pa ni mtshungs pa rnams pa bzhi zhes bya ste /
translated: sameness of syllables, sameness of voice, sameness of teaching, and sameness of body.

analyzed: 'di ltar mtshungs pa rnam pa 'di bzhi'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de skad du gsung ste /
translated: Because of these four kinds of sameness, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One says this.

original: de la yi ge mtshungs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yi ge mtshungs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is sameness of syllables?

translated: The nature of those letters is undifferentiated, and that is called the sameness of letters.

original: de la gsung mtshungs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gsung mtshungs pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the sameness of speech?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

analyzed: nga'i gsung rnam pa drug cu rtsa bzhi tshangs pa'i sgra skad kyi dbyangs kyi mtshan nyid du 'byung ngo //
translated: My speech has sixty-four qualities, which are the characteristics of the Brahmā voice.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag gi @390a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag gi @390a *//

analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams ni rnam par 'jig par byed pa ma yin te /

analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas de dag ni rang bzhin @393a *//
translated: the buddhas, the śrāvakas, and the pratyekabuddhas.🔽

original: gyis rnam par grol ba'i phyir dang / 'ching ba dang bcing ba'i rgyu dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gyis rnam par grol ba'i phyir dang / 'ching ba dang bcing ba'i rgyu dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The buddhas, śrāvakas, and pratyekabuddhas are naturally liberated because the causes of bondage and being bound are unreal.

analyzed: blo gros chen po /

analyzed: bcing ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: de skad du rnam par 'jig par byed pa smra ba 'di'ang med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de skad du rnam par 'jig par byed pa smra ba 'di'ang med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

analyzed: ngas de la dgongs nas gang zag tu lta ba ri rab tsam yod pa ni bla'i /

analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du ltung ba'i bsam pa can dag rang gi sems snang ba tsam du mi shes pas phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams mi rtag cing skad cig ma gcig nas gcig tu rnam par 'jig par mthong nas /

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams ni rgyun mi 'chad cing rnam par 'gyur ba dang / yi ge'i mtshan nyid dang bral bar rnam par rtog na'ang rnam par 'jig par byed pa yin no //

translated: When they conceptualize the aggregates, elements, and sense bases as uninterrupted and changing, and as devoid of the characteristics of letters, they are also destroying [the view of emptiness].

analyzed: spyod yul de dag rab spangs na //

analyzed: 'gog pa med pa ma yin te //

original: 'phags pa'i spyod yul ji bzhin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i spyod yul ji bzhin no //

original: rgyu med pa las skye 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: rgyu med pa las skye 'gyur zhing //

original: byung nas de ni 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: byung nas de ni 'gag par 'gyur //

original: rgyu rkyen yod dang med ces pa //
analyzed: rgyu rkyen yod dang med ces pa //
translated: “There are causes and conditions” and “there are not”

original: nga yi bstan la de mi gnas //
analyzed: nga yi bstan la de mi gnas //
translated: do not apply to my teaching.🔽They are not created by non-Buddhists, Buddhists,

original: mu stegs can dang sangs rgyas dang // nga dang gzhan gyis byas min te //
analyzed: mu stegs can dang sangs rgyas dang // nga dang gzhan gyis byas min te //

original: rgyu rkyen 'dus las 'byung yin na //
analyzed: rgyu rkyen 'dus las 'byung yin na //

analyzed: ji lta bur na med par 'gyur //

analyzed: rgyu rkyen yod pa sus bsags na //

original: med pa zhes ni rjod par byed //
analyzed: med pa zhes ni rjod par byed //

original: log lta smra ba chos skye ba //
analyzed: log lta smra ba chos skye ba //

original: rnam par rtog pas yod med brtags //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas yod med brtags //

original: gang gis cung zad skye med dang // 'gag pa med par rab shes pa //
analyzed: gang gis cung zad skye med dang // 'gag pa med par rab shes pa //

original: 'jig rten dben par mthong bas na //
analyzed: 'jig rten dben par mthong bas na //

analyzed: yod med gnyis las rnam par 'grol //

analyzed: de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then again, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Mahāmati made a request to the Bhagavān:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: bdag dang byang chub sems dpa' gzhan rnams la grub pa'i mtha'i tshul gyi mtshan nyid bshad du gsol /

analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid rtogs nas kyang myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub @394a *//
translated: Having understood its characteristics, we will quickly fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhing rtog pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bdud dang mu stegs can gyi rjes su 'brang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: We will not follow the characteristics of conceptualization, māras, and tīrthikas.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: “Mahāmati,

analyzed: de'i phyir shin tu legs par nyon la yid la gzung zhig dang / ngas khyod la bshad do //

analyzed: blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la de bzhin 'tshal lo zhes bka' mnyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: “Mahāmati,

analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi grub pa'i mtha'i tshul gyi mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te /

original: de la / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: de la / blo gros chen po /

analyzed: rtog pa can gyi 'du shes thams cad spangs pa /
translated: It is the abandonment of all the conceptual perceptions of those with ideas.

analyzed: mu stegs can dang / bdud thams cad btul nas so so rang gis rig pa'i tshul la dmigs pa'i 'od kyis rnam par mdzes pa de ni /
translated: It is the subduing of all the extremists and demons, and the radiance that illuminates the object of the mode of individual knowledge.

analyzed: grub pa'i mtha'i tshul gyi mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the characteristic of the mode of philosophical systems.

analyzed: de la bshad pa'i tshul gyi mtshan nyid @394b gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the characteristic of the mode of explanation?

analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: gsung rab yan lag rnam pa dgu sna tshogs su bshad pa yin te /

translated: The characteristic of the method of explanation is the abandonment of the characteristics of difference, non-difference, existence, non-existence, and so forth, and the attainment of liberation through teaching the Dharma in accordance with the inclinations of sentient beings with skillful means.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid yang bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //

original: grub pa'i mtha' dang bshad tshul ni //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' dang bshad tshul ni //
translated: The philosophical tenets and the method of explanation

analyzed: so so rang rig bstan pa ste //

analyzed: gang gis mthong zhing rab 'byed na //

original: de dag rtog pa'i dbang mi 'gro /
analyzed: de dag rtog pa'i dbang mi 'gro /
translated: are not under the power of conceptualization.

original: ji ltar byis pa rtog pa bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar byis pa rtog pa bzhin //
translated: As with the conceptualizations of the childish,

original: yang dag dngos po yod min na //
analyzed: yang dag dngos po yod min na //
translated: the real entity does not exist.

original: ci phyir rtog pa can rnams kyis //
analyzed: ci phyir rtog pa can rnams kyis //
translated: Why do those with conceptualization

original: dngos po med la thar par 'dod //
analyzed: dngos po med la thar par 'dod //

original: 'dus byas so sor rtog pa'i tshe //
analyzed: 'dus byas so sor rtog pa'i tshe //

analyzed: skye 'jig la sogs 'brel mthong ba //

original: lta ba gnyis po rgyas par byed //

analyzed: gcig pa de ni yang dag bden //

analyzed: nyes med de ni mya ngan 'das //

original: 'jig rten rnam rtog rab brtags na //

original: yang dag gang zag yod pa min //
analyzed: yang dag gang zag yod pa min //
translated: The person does not exist in reality.

original: sred pa las ni phung po 'byung //
analyzed: sred pa las ni phung po 'byung //
translated: The aggregates arise from craving.

original: srid pa sgyu ma rmi @395a *//
analyzed: srid pa sgyu ma rmi @395a *//

analyzed: lam 'dra // de nas byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Mahāmati made a request to the Blessed One:

analyzed: chos gang zhig la yang dag pa ma lags pa yongs su rtog lags /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: “Mahāmati,

analyzed: legs so // legs so //
translated: excellent, excellent!

translated: To think to ask the Tathāgata about such a matter is to benefit many beings, to bring happiness to many beings, to be compassionate toward the world, to act for the benefit and welfare of the world’s great multitude of devas and humans,

analyzed: phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir zhugs pa yin te /

analyzed: de'i phyir shin tu legs par nyon la yid la gzung zhig dang / ngas khyod la bshad do //

analyzed: blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /

original: legs so // legs so //
analyzed: legs so // legs so //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: de bzhin du 'tshal lo zhes bka' mnyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: blo gros chen po /

translated: the conceptualization of clinging arises from various different objects and various unreal conceptualizations.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / rang gi sems snang ba tsam du ma rtogs pa dang / yod pa dang med pa'i lta bar ltung ba; mu stegs can gyi lta ba shin tu rgyas par byed pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyis phyi rol gyi don sna tshogs la mngon par zhen pa dang /
analyzed: gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / rang gi sems snang ba tsam du ma rtogs pa dang / yod pa dang med pa'i lta bar ltung ba; mu stegs can gyi lta ba shin tu rgyas par byed pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyis phyi rol gyi don sna tshogs la mngon par zhen pa dang /

analyzed: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /

analyzed: chos rnams gang dag rnam gzhag pa //

analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba bzhin min te //

analyzed: de la / blo gros chen po /

analyzed: ye shes de ni rnam pa gsum yod de /

analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes gang zhe na /

analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa mchog gi ye shes gang zhe na /

analyzed: gzhan yang ye shes ni rnam pa gsum yod de /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

translated: The wisdom that realizes arising and destruction, the wisdom that realizes the characteristics of self and generality, and the wisdom that realizes non-arising and non-cessation.

analyzed: blo gros chen po /

analyzed: de la skye zhing 'jig pa ni rnam par shes pa'o //

analyzed: mi skye mi 'jig pa ni ye shes so //

original: 'das pa ni ye shes so //
analyzed: 'das pa ni ye shes so //

analyzed: dngos po dang thabs med pa'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid ni ye shes so //

analyzed: gzhan yang thob pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam par shes pa'o //

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid yang bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //

analyzed: las rnams gsog pa rnams shes te //

analyzed: mi gsog de ni ye shes so //

analyzed: chos rnams so sor rab brtags te //

analyzed: sems dang yid dang @400b rnam shes dang / rtogs pa'i 'du shes spangs pa dang // rnam rtog med pa'i chos thob pa //

original: sems tsam las ni 'das pa na //
analyzed: sems tsam las ni 'das pa na //

analyzed: bde gshegs ye shes dri ma med //

original: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /

analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: blo gros chen po /🔽chos gang yang skye ba'am /
analyzed: blo gros chen po / chos gang yang skye ba'am /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: 'jig pa med de /
analyzed: 'jig pa med de /

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid yang bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //

analyzed: dbyibs gnas dus ni 'gyur @401b ba las //

analyzed: 'byung ba chen po'i dbang po dang // srid pa bar ma rim skye bar //

analyzed: de dag ltar ni rtog ma yin // 'on kyang 'jig rten rten 'brel ni //
translated: Is not to be conceived in such a way.🔽Yet, just as in the case of a city of gandharvas,

analyzed: dri za'i grong khyer ji bzhin no //
translated: The world arises dependently.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The bodhisattva Mahāmati then said to the Blessed One:

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i don dang / rnam par grol ba'i don bshad du gsol /

analyzed: gal te mtshams sbyor ba dang / mtshams sbyor ba ma lags pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu 'byed pa la mkhas par gyur na /

translated: Through skill in the characteristics of the connections and non-connections of all phenomena, we have abandoned the conceptual mind of words and letters.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad bgrod cing 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dpag tu ma mchis par mchi ba dang / stobs dang / dbang ba dang / mngon par shes pa dang / gzungs kyi phyag rgya dang / sprul pa sna tshogs dang / 'od zer gyis kun tu gsal bar bgyid cing rig pa'i blos mthar thug pa'i @402a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad bgrod cing 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dpag tu ma mchis par mchi ba dang / stobs dang / dbang ba dang / mngon par shes pa dang / gzungs kyi phyag rgya dang / sprul pa sna tshogs dang / 'od zer gyis kun tu gsal bar bgyid cing rig pa'i blos mthar thug pa'i @402a *//
translated: We travel to all buddhafields and go to immeasurable maṇḍalas of retinues, and through the seal of strength, power, higher knowledge, dhāraṇī, various emanations, and light rays, we illuminate with the mind of knowledge.

original: gnas bcu la rab tu 'jug pa dang / sbyor ba mngon par 'du bgyid pa ma mchis pas nyi ma dang / zla ba dang / nor bu dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang mtshungs pa dang / sa thams cad la rang gi sems rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid du lta ba spangs shing chos thams cad sgyu ma dang /
analyzed: gnas bcu la rab tu 'jug pa dang / sbyor ba mngon par 'du bgyid pa ma mchis pas nyi ma dang / zla ba dang / nor bu dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang mtshungs pa dang / sa thams cad la rang gi sems rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid du lta ba spangs shing chos thams cad sgyu ma dang /
translated: It is to engage in the ten topics, to be like the sun, the moon, jewels, and the four great elements through being free from the formation of application, to abandon the view of one’s mind as the characteristic of conceptualization on all stages, and to enter the stage of buddhahood and the kāyas by seeing all phenomena as illusions, dreams, and so on.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa lta bur mthong bas sangs rgyas kyi sa dang sku la 'jug pa dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad la ci rigs par chos ston pas drangs te /
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa lta bur mthong bas sangs rgyas kyi sa dang sku la 'jug pa dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad la ci rigs par chos ston pas drangs te /

original: chos thams cad sgyu ma dang / rmi lam la sogs pa lta bur khong du chud par bgyi ba dang / mchis pa dang ma mchis pa'i phyogs dang / skye ba dang 'jig pa'i rnam par rtog pa spong bar brjod pa dang / tha dad pa'i don la rab tu 'god pas lus khyad par can du'ang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad sgyu ma dang / rmi lam la sogs pa lta bur khong du chud par bgyi ba dang / mchis pa dang ma mchis pa'i phyogs dang / skye ba dang 'jig pa'i rnam par rtog pa spong bar brjod pa dang / tha dad pa'i don la rab tu 'god pas lus khyad par can du'ang 'gyur ro //
translated: and to understand that all phenomena are like illusions, dreams, and so forth, and to abandon the extremes of existence and nonexistence and the conceptual thoughts of arising and ceasing, and to be established in the meaning of non-difference, one’s body will become special.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān replied:

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: legs so // legs so //
analyzed: legs so // legs so //

analyzed: de'i phyir shin tu legs par nyon la yid la zungs shig dang / ngas khyod la bshad do //

original: blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
analyzed: blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /

analyzed: de bzhin du 'tshal lo zhes bka' mnyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

analyzed: chos thams cad la sgra ji bzhin du mngon @402b mngon par zhan pa'i mtshams sbyor ba ni tshad med de /
translated: the attachment to the literal meaning of all phenomena is immeasurable.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: mtshan nyid la mngon bar zhen pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang / rkyen la mngon bar zhen pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang / dngos po dang dngos po med pa la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang / skye ba dang mi skye bar rnam par rtog pa la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: mtshan nyid la mngon bar zhen pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang / rkyen la mngon bar zhen pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang / dngos po dang dngos po med pa la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang / skye ba dang mi skye bar rnam par rtog pa la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang /

analyzed: 'gog pa ma yin par rnam par rtog pa mngon par zhen pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang / theg pa dang theg pa ma yin par rnam par rtog pa mngon par zhen pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas su rnam par rtog pa mngon par zhen pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang /
translated: the link of clinging to the concepts of noncessation, the link of clinging to the concepts of vehicle and nonvehicle, the link of clinging to the concepts of the compounded and the uncompounded,

original: sa dang sa'i rang gi mtshan nyid la rnam par rtog pa mngon par zhen pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang / rang gi rnam par rtog pa la bar chad med pa yod par rnam par rtog pa mngon par zhen pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang / yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs mu stegs can gyi gnas la rnam par rtog pa mngon par zhen pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: sa dang sa'i rang gi mtshan nyid la rnam par rtog pa mngon par zhen pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang / rang gi rnam par rtog pa la bar chad med pa yod par rnam par rtog pa mngon par zhen pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang / yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs mu stegs can gyi gnas la rnam par rtog pa mngon par zhen pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang /
translated: The link of the conception of the characteristics of the stages and their individual natures;🔽the link of the conception of the existence of uninterrupted conceptualization within one’s own conceptualization;🔽the link of the conception of the position of existence and nonexistence, which is the domain of the tīrthikas;

analyzed: theg pa gsum dang / theg pa gcig la bar chad med pa yod par rnam par rtog pa mngon par zhen pa'i mtshams sbyor ba'o //

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: de dag dang gzhan rnams kyang byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis rang gi @403a *//
analyzed: de dag dang gzhan rnams kyang byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis rang gi @403a *//
translated: these and others are the links of the conception of childish ordinary beings due to their own

analyzed: rnam par rtog pas mtshams sbyor ba yin te /
translated: conceptualization.

original: de ltar mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams rnam par rtog par byed pas ji ltar dar gyi srin bu skon par byed pa bzhin du rnam par rtog pa'i dar skud kyis bdag dang gzhan la yongs su dkri zhing yod pa dang med par
analyzed: de ltar mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams rnam par rtog par byed pas ji ltar dar gyi srin bu skon par byed pa bzhin du rnam par rtog pa'i dar skud kyis bdag dang gzhan la yongs su dkri zhing yod pa dang med par
translated: In this way, childish ordinary beings, due to conceptualization, are bound to existence and nonexistence by the thread of conceptualization, just as a silkworm is bound by the thread of its own making.

analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid la mngon par zhen to //

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
