analyzed: 'di la mtshams sbyor ba dang / mtshams mi sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid gang yang med de /
translated: there is neither the characteristic of connection nor disconnection here.

original: chos thams cad rab tu dben par mthong bas rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams chos thams cad rab tu dben par mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos thams cad rab tu dben par mthong bas rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams chos thams cad rab tu dben par mthong ngo //
translated: Because conceptualization does not arise due to seeing all phenomena as utterly isolated, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas see all phenomena as utterly isolated.

original: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
translated: Moreover, Mahāmati,

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams dngos po med pa dang / rang gi sems snang ba'i mtshan nyid du khong du chud cing snang ba med pa dang / rang gi sems snang ba tsam du so sor rtog pa'i rjes su 'brang ba dang / yod pa dang med pa'i dngos po thams cad kyi mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams dngos po med pa dang / rang gi sems snang ba'i mtshan nyid du khong du chud cing snang ba med pa dang / rang gi sems snang ba tsam du so sor rtog pa'i rjes su 'brang ba dang / yod pa dang med pa'i dngos po thams cad kyi mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: They understand that external things are non-things, and that the characteristics of their own mind’s appearances are non-existent. They follow the discernment that one’s own mind is mere appearance, and they see the absence of characteristics of all existent and non-existent things.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i mtshams sbyor ba rab tu dben par mthong ba'i phyir chos thams cad la mtshams sbyor ba'ang med /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i mtshams sbyor ba rab tu dben par mthong ba'i phyir chos thams cad la mtshams sbyor ba'ang med /
translated: Because they see the complete isolation of the connection with conceptuality, they do not connect with any phenomena.

original: mtshams sbyor ba ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyang med do //
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyang med do //
translated: They also do not have the characteristic of non-connection.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: @403b 'di la gang yang 'ching ba'am grol ba med de /
analyzed: @403b 'di la gang yang 'ching ba'am grol ba med de /
translated: here there is no bondage or liberation at all.

analyzed: gzhan du na yang dag pa ma yin par lhung ba'i blo can dag gis bcings pa dang grol ba yod par shes so //
translated: However, those with minds that have fallen into what is not real know that bondage and liberation exist.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: chos thams cad la yod pa dang / med pa dang / sems can mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all phenomena are not observed to exist, not observed to not exist, and not observed as sentient beings.

original: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
translated: Moreover, Mahāmati,

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi mtshams sbyor ba ni rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi mtshams sbyor ba ni rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: there are three kinds of connections for foolish ordinary beings:

analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug yin te /

analyzed: ma 'ongs pa la sred pa'ang srid pa la dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa des mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir /

analyzed: srid pa'i 'gro ba rnams su mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de'i mtshams sbyor ba ni 'gro ba lnga po rnams su mtshams sbyor ba yin te /

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba bcad pa la ni mtshams sbyor ba dang / mtshams sbyor ba ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid gang yang med do //
translated: for one who has severed the connection, there is no characteristic of connection or non-connection.

analyzed: gzhan yang blo gros chen po /

analyzed: gsum 'dus pa'i rkyen dang / bya ba'i sbyor ba la mngon par zhen pa rnam par shes pa rnams kyi mtshams sbyor ba bar chad med par 'byung ngo //

original: sbyor ba la mngon par zhen pas srid pa'i mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba la mngon par zhen pas srid pa'i mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: gsum 'dus pa'i rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa spangs shing rnam par thar pa gsum mthong na /
translated: When, having abandoned consciousness, one sees the three liberations through the condition of the coming together of the three,

analyzed: mtshams @404a *// sbyor ba thams cad mi 'byung ngo //
translated: all connections do not arise.

analyzed: mtshams sbyor dra ba chod par 'gyur //

translated: Like a silkworm in a cocoon,

analyzed: mtshams sbyor dra bas rang la 'ching //
translated: The net of attachment binds oneself.

original: byis pa rnam rtog rab bcings pas //
analyzed: byis pa rnam rtog rab bcings pas //

analyzed: mtshams sbyor so sor rtog mi byed ////
translated: They do not contemplate the individual connections.

original: 'phags pa langkar gshegs pa rin po che'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'phags pa langkar gshegs pa rin po che'i mdo las /
translated: From the noble Lankavatara Ratnasutra,

analyzed: bam po drug pa /
translated: Chapter Six

analyzed: yang blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
translated: Again, Mahamati said to the Blessed One:

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du rnam par rtog pa gang dang gang gis dngos po gang dang gang brtags pa de dang de dag ni kun brtags pa nyid de /

analyzed: de dag la rang bzhin med pas kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin kho na'o zhes gang gsungs pa /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

analyzed: gal te kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin tsam kho na ste /
translated: if it is only the imagined intrinsic nature,

analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid la ltos pa zhig ma lags na /
translated: and does not depend on the characteristics of the intrinsic nature of things,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / nam bar byang ba dngos po ma mchis par bka' stsal pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ba lags sa ma /

analyzed: chos thams @404b cad ni kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin nyid de dngos po ma mchis pa'i slad du'o //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: khyod kyis ji skad smras pa bzhin no //

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /

original: ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis dngos po'i rang bzhin du rnam par brtags pa ltar yang dag pa nyid ni de lta ma yin pas kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin de ni dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid du yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis dngos po'i rang bzhin du rnam par brtags pa ltar yang dag pa nyid ni de lta ma yin pas kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin de ni dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid du yod pa ma yin te /

analyzed: 'on kyang / blo gros chen po /

analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi ye shes kyis dngos po yod pa'i rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du 'phags pa'i ye shes dang / 'phags pa'i mthong ba dang / 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig gis dngos po'i rang bzhin de bzhin du rtogs so //
translated: The nature of the existence of things is realized just as it is by the wisdom of the noble ones, by the vision of the noble ones, and by the eye of the noble ones’ wisdom.

original: blo gros chen pos gsol pa /
analyzed: blo gros chen pos gsol pa /

analyzed: gal te 'phags pa rnams kyi 'phags pa'i ye shes dang / 'phags pa'i mthong ba dang / 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig gis lags kyi /

analyzed: lha'i mig dang / sha'i mig gi dngos po'i rang bzhin de bzhin du rtogs par mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo dag gis ji ltar brtags pa de ltar ma lags na /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: ji ltar gyis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa ldog par 'gyur te /

original: 'phags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dngos po khong du ma chud pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dngos po khong du ma chud pa'i slad du'o //
translated: Because they have not understood the nature of the reality of the noble ones.

original: bcom @405a *// ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom @405a *// ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de dag ni phyin ci log kyang ma lags /
analyzed: de dag ni phyin ci log kyang ma lags /

original: phyin ci ma log pa'ang ma lags so //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'ang ma lags so //

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: 'phags pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo'i rang bzhin khong du ma chud pa dang / mchis pa dang / ma mchis pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid ma mthong ba'i slad du'o //
translated: they have not understood the nature of the reality of the noble ones and have not seen the characteristic of the absence of existence and nonexistence.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'phags pa rnams ni 'di lta bu'i mthong bas de lta bu'i dngos po ltar rnam par brtags pa bzhin du mthong bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams ni 'di lta bu'i mthong bas de lta bu'i dngos po ltar rnam par brtags pa bzhin du mthong bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: the noble ones do not see such things in the way they are imagined by such a view.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul la spyod yul du mi bgyid pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul la spyod yul du mi bgyid pa'i slad du'o //
translated: Because they do not take the objects of their own characteristics as their domain.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de dag la'ang dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid rnams kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin nyid bzhin du snang ste /
analyzed: de dag la'ang dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid rnams kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin nyid bzhin du snang ste /

original: rgyu ma bstan pas rgyu ma mchis pa'i slad du 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rgyu ma bstan pas rgyu ma mchis pa'i slad du 'di lta ste /

analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyi lta bar lhung bas spyod yul tha dad par 'gyur te /

original: de dag ji lta ba bzhin du ma lags pas 'di ltar thug pa ma mchis pa'i nongs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag ji lta ba bzhin du ma lags pas 'di ltar thug pa ma mchis pa'i nongs par 'gyur te /
translated: Since they are not as they are, in this way there is the fault of infinite regress.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid khong du ma chud pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid khong du ma chud pa'i slad du'o //
translated: it is because they do not understand the characteristics of the nature of entities.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyus dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid ma lags na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyus dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid ma lags na /

original: ji ltar kun tu rtog pa de dag kun tu rtog par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: ji ltar kun tu rtog pa de dag kun tu rtog par mi 'gyur zhing /

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du kun brtags lags par khong du chud par 'gyur /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du kun brtags lags par khong du chud par 'gyur /
translated: How will they understand that they are conceptual thoughts just as they are?

original: bcom @405b ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom @405b ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: so sor rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyang gzhan /
analyzed: so sor rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyang gzhan /
translated: the characteristics of individual conceptual thoughts are one thing,

original: rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid kyang gzhan te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid kyang gzhan te /
translated: and the characteristics of the nature are another.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: rgyu mi mtshungs na rnam par rtog pa dang / rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid la de dag ci'i slad du so sor rnam par rtog par mi bgyid /
analyzed: rgyu mi mtshungs na rnam par rtog pa dang / rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid la de dag ci'i slad du so sor rnam par rtog par mi bgyid /
translated: If the causes are not the same, why do you not consider the characteristics of the nature of things to be different?

original: gzhan yang ci'i slad du byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin su mi rig ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang ci'i slad du byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin su mi rig ste /
translated: Moreover, why is it that ordinary beings do not know what is true just as it is?

original: 'on kyang sems can rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa yongs su spang pa'i phyir kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid bzhin no zhes bstan kyang yang dag pa yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs /
analyzed: 'on kyang sems can rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa yongs su spang pa'i phyir kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid bzhin no zhes bstan kyang yang dag pa yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs /
translated: Even though it is taught that it is like the imagined nature in order to eliminate the conceptions of sentient beings, it is said that it does not exist in reality.

original: bcom ldan 'das; ci'i slad du sems can rnams kyis mchis pa dang ma mchis pa dang mchis pa'i lta ba'i dngos po'i rang bzhin dang / 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul la mngon par zhen pa dang / mchis pa'i lta bar lhung ba la mngon par zhen pa bzlog nas stong pa'i chos ni dngos po med ngo zhes gsungs shing 'phags pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po bka' stsal /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das; ci'i slad du sems can rnams kyis mchis pa dang ma mchis pa dang mchis pa'i lta ba'i dngos po'i rang bzhin dang / 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul la mngon par zhen pa dang / mchis pa'i lta bar lhung ba la mngon par zhen pa bzlog nas stong pa'i chos ni dngos po med ngo zhes gsungs shing 'phags pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po bka' stsal /
translated: and why do they cling to falling into the view of existence, and then you, Bhagavān, having turned them away, teach the Dharma of emptiness as nonexistent things and the nature of the noble ones as things?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān replied:

original: blo gros chen po /🔽nga ni stong pa'i chos dngos po med par bshad pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: blo gros chen po / nga ni stong pa'i chos dngos po med par bshad pa'ang ma yin /
translated: Mahāmati,🔽I do not explain the Dharma of emptiness as nonexistent things,

original: yod pa'i lta bar lhung bas 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi dngos po bstan pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa'i lta bar lhung bas 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi dngos po bstan pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: nor do I teach the nature of the noble ones as things because of falling into the view of existence.

original: 'on kyang sems can rnams kyi sgrag pa'i gnas yongs su spang ba'i phyir sems can gang dag thog ma med pa'i dus nas dngos po'i rang @406a *//🔽bzhin gyi mtshan nyid la mngon par zhen pa /
analyzed: 'on kyang sems can rnams kyi sgrag pa'i gnas yongs su spang ba'i phyir sems can gang dag thog ma med pa'i dus nas dngos po'i rang @406a *// bzhin gyi mtshan nyid la mngon par zhen pa /
translated: However, in order to eliminate the abode of sentient beings’ views, I teach the Dharma of emptiness to those sentient beings who, from beginningless time, have fixated on the characteristics of the nature of things.🔽Those who view and fixate on the nature of things as the characteristics of the wisdom of the noble ones,

original: 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi dngos po'i rang bzhin la mtshan nyid du lta zhing mngon par zhen pa dag la stong pa nyid kyi chos bshad do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi dngos po'i rang bzhin la mtshan nyid du lta zhing mngon par zhen pa dag la stong pa nyid kyi chos bshad do //
translated: I teach the Dharma of emptiness to them.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: “Mahāmati,

original: ngas dngos po'i rang bzhin bstan pa ni med mod kyi /
analyzed: ngas dngos po'i rang bzhin bstan pa ni med mod kyi /
translated: I do not teach the nature of things to be nonexistent.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: 'on kyang nga ni rang nyid kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa /
analyzed: 'on kyang nga ni rang nyid kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa /
translated: however, I do teach the nature of things to be nonexistent to those who have not realized the nature of things as it is.🔽Mahāmati,

original: stong pa nyid kyi chos la rab tu gnas shing nor pa'i mtshan nyid du lta ba yongs su spangs pas rang gi sems snang ba dang / dngos po dang / dngos po med par lta ba dang bral ba rnam par thar pa gsum gyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa'i phyag rgyas shin tu btab cing dngos po'i rang bzhin rnams la so so rang gis rig pa'i blos so sor rab tu rtog
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi chos la rab tu gnas shing nor pa'i mtshan nyid du lta ba yongs su spangs pas rang gi sems snang ba dang / dngos po dang / dngos po med par lta ba dang bral ba rnam par thar pa gsum gyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa'i phyag rgyas shin tu btab cing dngos po'i rang bzhin rnams la so so rang gis rig pa'i blos so sor rab tu rtog
translated: Abiding in the Dharma of emptiness, they have abandoned the view of the characteristics of error. Therefore, their minds are free from the views of things, nonthings, and existence and nonexistence. They have been well-sealed with the mudrā of the three liberations, which is the perfect realization of things as they are. They individually and personally realize the nature of things with their own minds.

original: cing gnas pas yod pa dang / med pa'i dngos por lta ba'i mtshan nyid yongs su spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: cing gnas pas yod pa dang / med pa'i dngos por lta ba'i mtshan nyid yongs su spangs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, they have abandoned the characteristics of the views of existent and nonexistent things.

original: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
translated: “Moreover, Mahāmati,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad ma skyes pa'o zhes dam bca' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad ma skyes pa'o zhes dam bca' bar mi bya'o //
translated: bodhisattva mahāsattvas should not make the assertion, ‘All phenomena are unborn.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dam bca' ba'i dngos po thams cad dngos po med pa'i phyir dang / de'i rgyu las skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir chos thams cad ma skyes pa'o zhes dam bcas te smras na /
analyzed: dam bca' ba'i dngos po thams cad dngos po med pa'i phyir dang / de'i rgyu las skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir chos thams cad ma skyes pa'o zhes dam bcas te smras na /
translated: If you assert and say, “All things are unproduced because all things that are asserted do not exist and because they are characterized by being produced from causes,”

original: dam bcas pa de nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dam bcas pa de nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: then that assertion is undermined.

original: gang dam bcas pa des @406b chos thams cad ma skyes pa'o zhes dam bcas pa de nyams par 'gyur ba ni 'di ltar dam bca' ba'ang ltos pa yod pa las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang dam bcas pa des @406b chos thams cad ma skyes pa'o zhes dam bcas pa de nyams par 'gyur ba ni 'di ltar dam bca' ba'ang ltos pa yod pa las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That assertion is undermined because, by that assertion, “All things are unproduced,” that assertion is also produced in dependence.

original: yang ma skyes pa zhes dam bca' pa de ni chos thams cad kyi nang du gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang ma skyes pa zhes dam bca' pa de ni chos thams cad kyi nang du gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, that assertion, “They are unproduced,” is included among all things.

original: ma nyams pa'i mtshan nyid ni mi skye ba'i phyir chos thams cad ma skyes pa zhes dam bcas na smra ba de nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma nyams pa'i mtshan nyid ni mi skye ba'i phyir chos thams cad ma skyes pa zhes dam bcas na smra ba de nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you assert, “All things are unproduced,” because of the characteristic of non-production, then that assertion is undermined.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: yod pa dang med pa ma skyes par dam bcas pa'i dam bcas pa de ni dngos po thams cad kyi nang du gtogs pa yod pa dang med pa'i mtshan nyid mi dmigs so //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa ma skyes par dam bcas pa'i dam bcas pa de ni dngos po thams cad kyi nang du gtogs pa yod pa dang med pa'i mtshan nyid mi dmigs so //
translated: The thesis that existence and nonexistence are not produced is included among all things, and the characteristics of existence and nonexistence are not perceived.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: gal te dam bcas pa ma skyes pa des dngos po thams cad ma skyes pa'o zhes dam bca' bar byed na /
analyzed: gal te dam bcas pa ma skyes pa des dngos po thams cad ma skyes pa'o zhes dam bca' bar byed na /
translated: if that unproduced thesis were to posit that all things are unproduced,

original: de lta na'ang dam bcas pa las nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na'ang dam bcas pa las nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: then in that case the thesis would be lost,

original: 'di ltar yod pa dang med pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid ni mi skye ba'i phyir dam bca' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar yod pa dang med pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid ni mi skye ba'i phyir dam bca' bar mi bya'o //
translated: because the characteristics of existent and nonexistent things are not produced.

original: yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i smra ba ni nyes pa mang po'i phyir dang / phan tshun rgyu tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir dang / byas pa'i phyir yan lag rnams dam bca' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i smra ba ni nyes pa mang po'i phyir dang / phan tshun rgyu tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir dang / byas pa'i phyir yan lag rnams dam bca' bar mi bya'o //
translated: The branches should not be posited because of many faults, because of the characteristic of mutual difference in cause, and because of being produced.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: chos thams cad ma skyes pa dang / de bzhin du chos thams cad stong pa dang / rang bzhin med pa'o zhes dam bca' bar mi bya mod kyi /
analyzed: chos thams cad ma skyes pa dang / de bzhin du chos thams cad stong pa dang / rang bzhin med pa'o zhes dam bca' bar mi bya mod kyi /
translated: “One should not make assertions such as ‘all phenomena are unborn,’ and similarly, ‘all phenomena are empty’ and ‘lack intrinsic nature.’

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: 'on kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams @407a *//
analyzed: 'on kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams @407a *//
translated: however, bodhisattva mahāsattvas should teach that all phenomena

original: cad sgyu ma dang / rmi lam lta bu bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: cad sgyu ma dang / rmi lam lta bu bstan par bya ste /
translated: are like illusions and dreams,

original: snang ba dang / mi snang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir lta ba dang / blo slu bar byed pa'i phyir chos thams cad sgyu ma dang / rmi lam lta bu'i ngo bo nyid du bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: snang ba dang / mi snang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir lta ba dang / blo slu bar byed pa'i phyir chos thams cad sgyu ma dang / rmi lam lta bu'i ngo bo nyid du bstan par bya'o //
translated: because they have the characteristics of appearing and not appearing, and because they deceive the view and the mind, all phenomena should be taught to have the nature of being like illusions and dreams.

original: gzhan du na byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams skrag pa'i gnas spangs bar bya ba'i phyir dang / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: gzhan du na byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams skrag pa'i gnas spangs bar bya ba'i phyir dang / blo gros chen po /
translated: Otherwise, in order to avoid being a source of fear for ordinary, childish beings, Mahāmati,

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams yod pa dang / med pa'i lta bar lhung ba de dag skrag par mi 'gyur zhing theg pa chen po las ring du mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams yod pa dang / med pa'i lta bar lhung ba de dag skrag par mi 'gyur zhing theg pa chen po las ring du mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order that foolish ordinary beings who have fallen into the views of existence and non-existence may not be frightened and may not fall far from the Great Vehicle.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid yang bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid yang bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
translated: Then the Lord, in order to teach just this meaning, recited these verses:

original: rang bzhin med pas brjod du med //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pas brjod du med //
translated: “Because of the absence of intrinsic nature, there is no expression.

original: dngos po med cing mtshams sbyor med //
analyzed: dngos po med cing mtshams sbyor med //
translated: There is no entity, no connection.

original: 'di dag ro bzhin gyis pa yi //
analyzed: 'di dag ro bzhin gyis pa yi //
translated: These are like a corpse,

original: log pa'i blo yis rnam par brtags //
analyzed: log pa'i blo yis rnam par brtags //
translated: imagined by a mistaken mind.

original: chos rnams thams cad ma skyes pa //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad ma skyes pa //
translated: All phenomena are unborn,

original: de ni mu stegs gzhung ma yin //
analyzed: de ni mu stegs gzhung ma yin //
translated: not the doctrine of the tīrthikas.

original: mthar ni skye ba gang yang med //
analyzed: mthar ni skye ba gang yang med //
translated: In the end, there is no birth at all,

original: dngos po rkyen gyis bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po rkyen gyis bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: an entity is established by conditions.

original: chos rnams thams cad ma skyes pas //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad ma skyes pas //
translated: Because all phenomena are unborn,

original: blo ldan mtshan mar 'dzin mi byed //
analyzed: blo ldan mtshan mar 'dzin mi byed //
translated: the wise do not grasp at signs.

original: dam bcas rgyu las skyes pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dam bcas rgyu las skyes pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of the assertion arising from a cause,

original: mkhas pa dag gis yongs su spong //
analyzed: mkhas pa dag gis yongs su spong //

analyzed: 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir shes pa'ang mi 'jug ste /

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: de ste ri brag dang / rtsig pa dang / sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung gis bar du chod pa'i slad du shes pas mi dmigs lags sam /

analyzed: ha cang thag ring ba dang / nye ba nyid du shes pas mi dmigs lags sam /

analyzed: 'on te rgan po dang / byis pa dang / long ba rnams dbang po dang mi ldan pa'i slad du shes pas mi dmigs lags /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

original: mi shes pa zhes bgyi ste /
analyzed: mi shes pa zhes bgyi ste /

analyzed: don mchis kyang mi dmigs pa'i slad du'o //

analyzed: de ste rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid sna tshogs kyis dngos po'i ngo bo nyid zil du rlag pa'i slad du shes pas mi dmigs pa zhig lags na ni de'ang mi shes pa @408b ste /
translated: If it is because of the various specific and general characteristics destroying the nature of entities that it is not apprehended by cognition, then that also is non-cognition.

original: shes pa ma lags so //
analyzed: shes pa ma lags so //
translated: It is not cognition.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

original: shes bya mchis pa'i slad du shes pa 'byung gi /
analyzed: shes bya mchis pa'i slad du shes pa 'byung gi /

original: dngos po ma mchis pa las ni ma lags te /

analyzed: shes bya dang ldan pa'i slad du shes pa zhes bgyi'o //

analyzed: de ste ri brag dang / rtsig pa dang / sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung gis chod pa rnams dang / rgyang ring po dang / nye ba dang / rgan po dang / byis pa dang / long par gyur pas dbang po rnams ma tshang bar gyur pa'i slad du shes pas mi dmigs pa lags na ni /
translated: If it is because of being obstructed by mountains, cliffs, walls, earth, water, fire, or wind, or because of being far away, near, old, young, or blind, and so on, and the faculties are incomplete, then it is not observed by consciousness.

original: de'ang shes pa zhes mi bgyi bas mi shes pa lags te /
analyzed: de'ang shes pa zhes mi bgyi bas mi shes pa lags te /
translated: And that is not called consciousness, so it is not known.

original: dngos po mchis kyang mi dmigs pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: dngos po mchis kyang mi dmigs pa'i slad du'o //
translated: Because although the thing exists, it is not observed.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: blo gros chen po / de ni de ltar mi shes pa ma yin te /

analyzed: shes pa yin pas mi shes pa ma yin no //

analyzed: ngas de la ldem por dgongs te /

analyzed: nam dmigs pa'i dngos po shes pas mi dmigs pa de na btags pa tsam du rnam par bzhag pa yin no zhes ma bshad de /

original: rang gi sems snang ba tsam du khong du ma chud pas yod pa dang med pa las phyi rol gyi dngos po dang dngos po med pa srid par shes pas dngos po mi dmigs pa'i phyir shes pa shes bya la mi 'jug go /

translated: Since they do not understand that appearances are one’s own mind, they think that external things and nonthings exist, and so they do not apprehend things. Therefore, consciousness does not engage objects of consciousness.

analyzed: rnam par thar pa gsum gyi rjes su shes pa'ang mi dmigs te /

translated: Those who have concepts, whose minds are stained by the latent tendencies of the elaborations of things and nonthings since beginningless time, do not understand it in that way.

analyzed: shes pa des de dag ma shes pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin la dngos po med do zhes rnam par rtog pa mi spong gi /

analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba tsam rnam par 'jog pas bdag dang bdag gi mtshan nyid du 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen te /

analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba tsam du ma chud pas shes pa dang shes bya la so sor rnam par rtog ste /

analyzed: de ni log pa'i shes pa yin //
translated: that is a false consciousness.

analyzed: rgan po byis pa ldongs gyur dag /

analyzed: shes bya yang dag yod bzhin du //

analyzed: shes pa rnams ni mi skye ba //

analyzed: de yang log pa'i shes la yin //

analyzed: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /

analyzed: rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i mtha' bzhi rnam par dag pa'i tshul gyi mtshan nyid rnam par 'byed pa la mi mkhas so //

analyzed: blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: grub pa'i tshul bdag la bshad du gsol //

analyzed: de'i phyir legs par nyon la yid la gzung zhig dang ngas khyod la bshad do //

original: de ni bstan pa'i tshul zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni bstan pa'i tshul zhes bya'o //

original: de la rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i tshul ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i tshul ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams rang gi sems snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa sna tshogs yongs su spangs nas /
translated: Yogis and yoginīs abandon the various conceptual thoughts of the appearances of their own minds.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: gcig pa dang / tha dad pa dang / gnyis ka dang / gnyis ka ma yin pa'i phyogs su ma lhung ba /

analyzed: sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa thams cad las shin tu 'das pa /

analyzed: rgyu dang / rigs pa dang / lta ba'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba /

original: mu stegs can dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa mtha' gnyis su lhung ba thams cad kyis mi shes pa de ni ngas rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i tshul gyi chos so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: mu stegs can dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa mtha' gnyis su lhung ba thams cad kyis mi shes pa de ni ngas rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i tshul gyi chos so zhes bshad do //

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /

analyzed: de ni rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i tshul dang / bstan pa'i tshul gyi mtshan nyid ces bya ste /

analyzed: de la khyod dang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan dag gis bsgrub cing bslab par bya'o //
translated: You and other bodhisattva mahāsattvas should accomplish and train in that.

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis @410b don de nyid yang bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di gsungs so //
translated: Then, the Bhagavān, in order to teach just that point, spoke this verse:

original: nga yi tshul ni rnam gnyis te //
analyzed: nga yi tshul ni rnam gnyis te //
translated: My system is twofold:

original: grub pa'i mtha' dang bstan pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' dang bstan pa'o //
translated: The philosophical system and the teaching.

original: byis pa rnams la brjod pa bshad //
analyzed: byis pa rnams la brjod pa bshad //
translated: The teaching is explained for the childish,

original: rnal 'byor pa la grub mtha'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa la grub mtha'o //
translated: The philosophical system is for the yogis.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Mahāmati made a request to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis dus gcig gi tshe 'di skad du 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i smra ba dang / spobs pa can sna tshogs la bslab cing bsnyen par mi bya'o //
translated: why is it that at one time the Blessed One said this: ‘One should not train in or attend to the various worldly sophistries, orators, and eloquent ones.

analyzed: de la slob cing bsnyen nas zang zing sdud de /

analyzed: chos sdud pa ma yin no // zhes gsungs na /

original: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du de skad ces bka' stsal /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du de skad ces bka' stsal /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: “Mahāmati,

original: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa rnams ni sna tshogs pa'i tshig gi tshogs dang / rgyu dang rkyen dang / dpe rnams sdud cing 'god pa dag gis byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams slu zhing rnam par rmongs par byed pas yang dag pa de kho na'i rang gi tshul la 'jug par mi byed la chos thams cad khong du mi chud de /
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa rnams ni sna tshogs pa'i tshig gi tshogs dang / rgyu dang rkyen dang / dpe rnams sdud cing 'god pa dag gis byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams slu zhing rnam par rmongs par byed pas yang dag pa de kho na'i rang gi tshul la 'jug par mi byed la chos thams cad khong du mi chud de /
translated: The Lokāyatas deceive and confuse ordinary people with various collections of words, causes, conditions, and examples, and so they do not enter into the correct, true, intrinsic nature. They do not understand any phenomena.

original: phyin ci log tu rnam par rtog pas mtha' gnyis su lhung ba dang / byis pa dag shin tu rmongs par byed cing bdag nyid kyis yang rnam par 'jig pas 'gro ba rnams su mtshams sbyor gyi /🔽rnam par grol ni @411a *//
analyzed: phyin ci log tu rnam par rtog pas mtha' gnyis su lhung ba dang / byis pa dag shin tu rmongs par byed cing bdag nyid kyis yang rnam par 'jig pas 'gro ba rnams su mtshams sbyor gyi / rnam par grol ni @411a *//
translated: Because of their mistaken conceptions, they fall into the two extremes, and they cause childish beings to become confused. Because they themselves are also destroyed, they connect with the realms of sentient beings.

original: mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: mi 'thob ste /
translated: They do not attain liberation.

original: rang gi sems snang ba cam du khong du ma chud cing phyi rol gyi dngos po'i rang bzhin ma spangs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa la mngon par zhen pas so //
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba cam du khong du ma chud cing phyi rol gyi dngos po'i rang bzhin ma spangs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa la mngon par zhen pas so //
translated: This is because they do not understand that [appearances] are merely one’s own mind and they do not abandon the nature of external things. They are fixated on conceptuality.

original: de lta bas na 'jig rten rgyang ban pa spobs pa sna tshogs can ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / 'khrug pa las yongs su mi 'grol te /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'jig rten rgyang ban pa spobs pa sna tshogs can ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / 'khrug pa las yongs su mi 'grol te /
translated: Therefore, the Lokāyata, who is skilled in various sophistries, does not liberate from birth, old age, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, and mental disturbance.

original: yongs su slu zhing shin tu rmongs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su slu zhing shin tu rmongs par byed pa yin no //
translated: He is a deceiver and a great fool.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: brgya byin lha'i dbang po bstan bcos mang po la mkhas pas bdag nyid kyis sgra'i bstan bcos byas pa las 'jig rten rgyang pan pa de'i slob ma klu'i gzugs dang cha byad 'dzin pa zhig brgya byin lha'i dbang po'i gnas su song nas /
analyzed: brgya byin lha'i dbang po bstan bcos mang po la mkhas pas bdag nyid kyis sgra'i bstan bcos byas pa las 'jig rten rgyang pan pa de'i slob ma klu'i gzugs dang cha byad 'dzin pa zhig brgya byin lha'i dbang po'i gnas su song nas /
translated: Śakra, lord of the gods, skilled in many treatises, composed a treatise on grammar himself. A student of that Lokāyata, taking on the form and appearance of a nāga, went to the abode of Śakra, lord of the gods,

original: 'di skad du dam bcas so //
analyzed: 'di skad du dam bcas so //
translated: and made this declaration:

original: bdag khyod dang chos smra bar bya ste /
analyzed: bdag khyod dang chos smra bar bya ste /

original: gal te khyod kyis bdag ma thub par gyur na ni khyod kyi rtsibs stong dang ldan pa'i 'khor lo gzhig par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te khyod kyis bdag ma thub par gyur na ni khyod kyi rtsibs stong dang ldan pa'i 'khor lo gzhig par bya'o //
translated: If you are unable to defeat me, I will destroy your thousand-spoked wheel.”

original: bdag pham par gyur na ni mgo re re nas bcad de pham pa'i nyes pa khas blang ngo zhes dam bcas nas chos smras pa las brgya byin lha'i dbang po pham par byas te /
analyzed: bdag pham par gyur na ni mgo re re nas bcad de pham pa'i nyes pa khas blang ngo zhes dam bcas nas chos smras pa las brgya byin lha'i dbang po pham par byas te /
translated: Having made this pledge, he debated and defeated Śakra, lord of the gods.

original: 'khor lo rtsibs stong dang ldan pa bshig nas slar mi'i 'jig rten 'dir 'ongs so //
analyzed: 'khor lo rtsibs stong dang ldan pa bshig nas slar mi'i 'jig rten 'dir 'ongs so //
translated: He destroyed the thousand-spoked wheel and returned to this human world.

original: de ltar / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: de ltar / blo gros chen po /
translated: Thus, Mahāmati,

original: 'jig @411b rten rgyang pan pa rgyu dang dpe sna tshogs bkod pas 'di ltar tha na byol song du gyur pas kyang tshig gi tshogs rnam pa sna tshogs kyis lha dang lha ma yin rnams shin tu rmongs par byed cing /
analyzed: 'jig @411b rten rgyang pan pa rgyu dang dpe sna tshogs bkod pas 'di ltar tha na byol song du gyur pas kyang tshig gi tshogs rnam pa sna tshogs kyis lha dang lha ma yin rnams shin tu rmongs par byed cing /
translated: the Lokāyata, by setting forth various causes and examples, thoroughly confuses the gods and asuras with various collections of words, even causing animals to do so.

analyzed: skye ba dang / 'jig pa'i lta ba la rab tu 'god par byed na /

analyzed: mi rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos /

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa rnams yongs su spang bar bya ste /
translated: the Lokāyata should be completely abandoned.

original: sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyu 'thob par byed pas bslab cing bsnyen par mi bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyu 'thob par byed pas bslab cing bsnyen par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they should not be studied or attended to, because they cause the attainment of the causes of suffering.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /

analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa rnams ni lus dang blos yul dmigs pa tsam du ston to //
translated: the Lokāyatas teach that the objects of the body and mind are mere appearances.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa de dag stong phrag brgya yod de /
translated: there are one hundred and eight Lokāyatas.

analyzed: phyi ma'i dus lnga brgya tha ma la bstan pa bsdus pa rnams 'jig par byed cing rtog ge ngan pa'i rgyu dang / lta ba rnams rgyas par 'gyur ba na slob ma ngan pa rnams yongs su 'dzin par byed do //
translated: In the later time of the final five hundred years, they will destroy the collected teachings, and when the causes of bad reasoning and views are spreading, they will hold on to bad students.

original: 'di ltar / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: 'di ltar / blo gros chen po /
translated: Thus, Mahāmati,

analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa bsdus pa 'jig par byed pa rnams ni tshig gi tshogs dang / rgyu dang / dpe sna tshogs bkod pas mu stegs kyi dngos po brjod cing rang gi rkyen la mngon par zhen pas rab gi tshul yod pa ma yin no //
translated: the Lokāyatas who destroy the collected teachings, by setting forth various collections of words, causes, and examples, speak of the things of the tīrthikas, but due to their own conditions, they do not have the method of the highest.

analyzed: blo gros chen po / mu stegs can de dag la rang gi tshul gyi bstan bcos med pas gzhan dag la 'jig rten rgyang pan pa rnams dngos po'i @412a *//
translated: Mahāmati,

analyzed: sgo brgya stong du ma tshad med pa rnams rgya cher ston par byed de /
translated: since those tīrthikas do not have treatises of their own system, they extensively teach others the Lokāyata, with its hundreds of thousands of doors of things.

analyzed: rang gi tshul yod pa ma yin pa dang / blun zhing gti mug pa 'jig rten rgyang pan pa yin par rang gis mi shes so //
translated: Since they do not have their own system, they are foolish and ignorant, but they do not understand that they are Lokāyatas.

original: de la blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de la blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Mahāmati said to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

analyzed: gal te mu stegs can 'jig rten rgyang pan pa rnams tshig gi tshogs dang / rgyu dang / dpe sna tshogs su 'brel bas rang gi tshul ma mchis te /
translated: if the tīrthikas, the Lokāyatas, do not have their own system because of their various collections of words, causes, and examples,

analyzed: rang gi dngos po la mngon par zhen pa lags na ni /
translated: and if they are attached to their own entities,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang 'jig rten rgyang pan pa nyid ston te /
translated: then the Blessed One also teaches Lokāyata.

original: 'di ltar phyogs tha dad pa sna tshogs nas 'dus pa'i 'khor lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin rnams la tshig gi tshogs rnam pa sna tshogs tshad ma mchis pa rnams kyis rgya cher gsung bas /
analyzed: 'di ltar phyogs tha dad pa sna tshogs nas 'dus pa'i 'khor lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin rnams la tshig gi tshogs rnam pa sna tshogs tshad ma mchis pa rnams kyis rgya cher gsung bas /
translated: In this way, the Bhagavān, with immeasurable various collections of words, extensively teaches the assembly of devas, humans, and asuras gathered from various directions.

original: de'ang rang gi tshul ma mchis pa ma lags sam /
analyzed: de'ang rang gi tshul ma mchis pa ma lags sam /
translated: Is it not the case that he does not have his own system?

analyzed: mu stegs can gyi shes pa dang / tha snyad brjod pa'i grangs su mchi ba ma lags sam /
translated: Is it not the case that he is counted among the proponents of non-Buddhist terminology?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān replied:

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: “Mahāmati,

original: nga ni 'jig rten rgyang pa na mi 'chad de /
analyzed: nga ni 'jig rten rgyang pa na mi 'chad de /
translated: I do not teach the Lokāyata.

original: 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med pas 'ong ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa 'ba' zhig tu ston te /
analyzed: 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med pas 'ong ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa 'ba' zhig tu ston te /
translated: I teach only the absence of coming and going, because there is no coming and going.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

analyzed: 'ong ba zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba rnams 'dus pa las skye ba'o //
translated: what is called ‘coming’ is the arising of goings.

original: 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'jig pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'jig pa ste /
translated: What is called ‘going’ is destruction.

original: 'gro @412b ba med pa dang / 'ong ba med pa ni mi skye mi 'jig pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gro @412b ba med pa dang / 'ong ba med pa ni mi skye mi 'jig pa yin no //
translated: The absence of going and coming is non-arising and non-destruction.”

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: ngas bshad pa'i chos rnams ni 'jig rten rgyang pan bar lhung ba dang / rnam par rtog pa'i grangs su gtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ngas bshad pa'i chos rnams ni 'jig rten rgyang pan bar lhung ba dang / rnam par rtog pa'i grangs su gtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: the dharmas I have taught do not fall into the realm of the Lokāyatas, nor do they belong to the enumeration of conceptual thoughts.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po dang / dngos po med pa la mngon par ma zhen cing rang gi sems snang ba tsam la gnas pas mtha' gnyis kyi rnam par rtog pas mi g-yos la mtshan ma'i spyod yul dngos po med pa dang / rang gi sems snang ba tsam du khong du chud pas rang gi sems snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa mi skye ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po dang / dngos po med pa la mngon par ma zhen cing rang gi sems snang ba tsam la gnas pas mtha' gnyis kyi rnam par rtog pas mi g-yos la mtshan ma'i spyod yul dngos po med pa dang / rang gi sems snang ba tsam du khong du chud pas rang gi sems snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa mi skye ste /
translated: Because of not being attached to external things and non-things, and by abiding in the mere appearance of one's own mind, one does not waver due to the two extremes of conceptual thought. By comprehending that the sphere of signs is non-existent and is merely the appearance of one's own mind, the conceptual thought of the appearance of one's own mind does not arise.

original: rnam par rtog pa mi skye ba ni stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i rnam par thar pa gsum la zhugs pas rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa mi skye ba ni stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i rnam par thar pa gsum la zhugs pas rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The non-arising of conceptual thought is called 'liberation' by engaging in the three doors of liberation: emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: ngas mngon par dran pa dus gcig gi tshes phyogs shig na 'dug pa na bram ze'i 'jig rten rgyang pan pa zhig nga ga la ba der 'ongs nas rab tu dben pa ma 'di bar nga la 'di skad ces zer ro //
analyzed: ngas mngon par dran pa dus gcig gi tshes phyogs shig na 'dug pa na bram ze'i 'jig rten rgyang pan pa zhig nga ga la ba der 'ongs nas rab tu dben pa ma 'di bar nga la 'di skad ces zer ro //
translated: I remember that once, on a certain day, a brahmin wandering ascetic came to me, and in this solitary place he said to me:

original: kye goo ta ma /
analyzed: kye goo ta ma /
translated: “O Gautama!

original: thams cad byas pa yin nam /
analyzed: thams cad byas pa yin nam /
translated: Is everything created?”

original: ngas de'i tshe 'di skad du /
analyzed: ngas de'i tshe 'di skad du /
translated: At that time I said to him:

original: kye bram ze thams cad byas pa zhes zer ba 'di ni 'jig rten rgyang pan pa dang po'o //
analyzed: kye bram ze thams cad byas pa zhes zer ba 'di ni 'jig rten rgyang pan pa dang po'o //
translated: “O brahmin, saying ‘everything is created’ is the first wandering ascetic view.

original: des yang dris pa /
analyzed: des yang dris pa /
translated: He asked again:

original: thams cad ma byas pa yin nam /
analyzed: thams cad ma byas pa yin nam /

analyzed: ngas yang 'di skad du thams cad byas pa ma yin pa 'di ni 'jig rten rgyang pan pa gnyis pa yin no zhes @413a *//
translated: I said again: ‘Saying “everything is not created” is the second wandering ascetic view.’

original: smras so // des yang dris pa /🔽thams cad rtag pa'am /
analyzed: smras so // des yang dris pa / thams cad rtag pa'am /
translated: He asked again:🔽‘Is everything permanent?

original: thams cad mi rtag pa'am /🔽thams cad skye ba'am /
analyzed: thams cad mi rtag pa'am / thams cad skye ba'am /
translated: Is everything impermanent?🔽Is everything born?

original: thams cad mi skye ba'am /
analyzed: thams cad mi skye ba'am /
translated: Is everything unborn?’

original: ngas de'i tshe 'di skad du de dag ni 'jig rten rgyang pan pa drug pa'o zhes smras so //
analyzed: ngas de'i tshe 'di skad du de dag ni 'jig rten rgyang pan pa drug pa'o zhes smras so //
translated: At that time, I said, ‘Those are the six Lokāyatas.’

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: “Mahāmati,

original: des yang 'di skad du thams cad gcig pa'am /
analyzed: des yang 'di skad du thams cad gcig pa'am /
translated: he asked again, ‘Are all things the same?

original: thams cad tha dad pa'am /🔽thams cad gnyis ka'am /
analyzed: thams cad tha dad pa'am / thams cad gnyis ka'am /
translated: Are all things different?🔽Are all things both?

original: thams cad gnyis ka ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: thams cad gnyis ka ma yin pa'am /

analyzed: chos sdud pa ma yin no zhes bka' stsal ces dris pa'i 'o //

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahamati,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / 'khrug pa rnams te /

analyzed: chos sdud pa gang zhe na /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

translated: fully understanding and comprehending that appearances are one’s own mind only, not giving rise to conceptual thoughts through attaining the characteristics of the selflessness of persons and phenomena, the mind, thought, and mental consciousness turning back through being extremely skilled in the stages,

analyzed: yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa ldog pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ye shes dang / dbang bskur ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / mthar thug pa med pa'i gnas bcu yongs su gzung ba dang / chos thams cad la rtsol ba med par dbang byed pa ni chos zhes bya ste /
translated: the wisdom of all buddhas, the perfection of empowerment, upholding the ten stages without end, and controlling all phenomena without effort is called the Dharma.

original: de ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: lta ba thams cad dang / spros pa thams cad dang / rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang / dngos po thams cad dang / mtha' gnyis thams @416a *//
analyzed: lta ba thams cad dang / spros pa thams cad dang / rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang / dngos po thams cad dang / mtha' gnyis thams @416a *//
translated: all views,🔽all conceptual elaborations,🔽all thoughts,🔽all entities,🔽and all two extremes.

original: cad du mi ltung ngo //
analyzed: cad du mi ltung ngo //
translated: He does not fall into any views, any conceptual elaborations, any discriminations, any entities, or any of the two extremes.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: mu stegs can byis pa rnams ni phal cher rtag pa dang / chad pa'i mtha' gnyis su ltung gi mkhas pa rnams ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mu stegs can byis pa rnams ni phal cher rtag pa dang / chad pa'i mtha' gnyis su ltung gi mkhas pa rnams ni ma yin no //
translated: childish tīrthikas mostly fall into the two extremes of eternalism and nihilism, but not the wise.

original: de la rgyu med par smra ba yongs su bzung bas ni rtag par lta ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la rgyu med par smra ba yongs su bzung bas ni rtag par lta ba 'byung ngo //
translated: There, the view of eternalism arises from the acceptance of the doctrine of causelessness.

original: phyi rol gyi rgyu 'jig cing rgyu dang rkyen dngos po med par mthong ba las ni chad par lta ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rgyu 'jig cing rgyu dang rkyen dngos po med par mthong ba las ni chad par lta ba 'byung ste /
translated: The view of nihilism arises from the destruction of external causes and the perception of causes and conditions as non-existent.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: de ni skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa mi mthong ba'i phyir chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa mi mthong ba'i phyir chos zhes bya'o //
translated: that is called the Dharma because it is not seen to arise, abide, or perish.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: de ni zang zing dang chos zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ni zang zing dang chos zhes bya ste /
translated: that is called material and Dharma.

original: de la khyod dang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan dag gis bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: de la khyod dang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan dag gis bslab par bya'o //
translated: You and other bodhisattva great beings should train in this.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid yang bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid yang bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One, in order to teach this very meaning, spoke these verses:

original: 'jig rten rgyang pan thams cad ni //
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang pan thams cad ni //
translated: All worldly philosophies

original: mu stegs can gyis bshad de rdzun //
analyzed: mu stegs can gyis bshad de rdzun //
translated: Are taught by non-Buddhists and are false.

original: rnam rtog byed dang bya bar mthong //
analyzed: rnam rtog byed dang bya bar mthong //
translated: They see agent and action,

original: de la rang gi grub mtha' med //
analyzed: de la rang gi grub mtha' med //
translated: But have no philosophy of their own.

original: nga yi grub mtha' 'di 'ba' zhig /
analyzed: nga yi grub mtha' 'di 'ba' zhig /
translated: Only this philosophy of mine

original: byed dang bya ba yongs su spangs //
analyzed: byed dang bya ba yongs su spangs //
translated: Completely abandons agent and action.

original: 'jig rten rgyang pan rnam bral ba //
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang pan rnam bral ba //
translated: Free from worldly philosophies,

original: slob ma rnams la rab tu bshad //
analyzed: slob ma rnams la rab tu bshad //
translated: I teach it to my disciples.

original: sems tsam de ni mi dmigs pas //
analyzed: sems tsam de ni mi dmigs pas //
translated: That mind-only is not observed,

original: sems gnyis so sor rtog mi byed //
analyzed: sems gnyis so sor rtog mi byed //
translated: One does not conceive of two minds.

original: gzung dang 'dzin pa dngos med de //
analyzed: gzung dang 'dzin pa dngos med de //
translated: The absence of object and subject,

original: rtag chad gnyis ka yongs su spangs //
analyzed: rtag chad gnyis ka yongs su spangs //
translated: Completely abandoning both permanence and annihilation.

original: ji srid sems ni 'jug pa'i @416b bar //
analyzed: ji srid sems ni 'jug pa'i @416b bar //
translated: For as long as the mind engages,

original: de srid 'jig rten rgyang pan yin //
analyzed: de srid 'jig rten rgyang pan yin //
translated: For that long it is a worldly philosophy.

original: rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug na //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug na //
translated: If conceptualization does not engage,

original: des ni rang gi sems mthong ngo //
analyzed: des ni rang gi sems mthong ngo //
translated: One sees one’s own mind.

original: 'ong tshe dngos po skye zhes bya //
analyzed: 'ong tshe dngos po skye zhes bya //
translated: When it comes, it is called the arising of things.

original: 'gro tshe dngos po yong mi snang /
analyzed: 'gro tshe dngos po yong mi snang /
translated: When it goes, things do not appear.

original: 'gro 'ong legs par gsal rtogs na //
analyzed: 'gro 'ong legs par gsal rtogs na //
translated: If one clearly understands coming and going,

original: rnam par rtog pa yang mi skye //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yang mi skye //
translated: One will not give rise to conceptualization.

original: rtag pa dang ni mi rtag pa //
analyzed: rtag pa dang ni mi rtag pa //
translated: Permanence and impermanence,

original: byas pa dang ni ma byas pa //
analyzed: byas pa dang ni ma byas pa //
translated: The created and the uncreated,

original: 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten gzhan //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten gzhan //
translated: This world and other worlds—

original: thams cad 'jig rten rgyang pan tshul //
analyzed: thams cad 'jig rten rgyang pan tshul //
translated: All are the ways of the Lokāyatas.

original: de nas yang blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas yang blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then again, Mahāmati said to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bgyi ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bgyi ba /
translated: “Blessed One!

original: chos ji lta bu zhig la mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bgyi na /
analyzed: chos ji lta bu zhig la mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bgyi na /
translated: What kind of phenomena are called nirvāṇa?

original: mu stegs can rnams so so nas rnam par rtog pa skyed par bgyid /
analyzed: mu stegs can rnams so so nas rnam par rtog pa skyed par bgyid /
translated: The tīrthikas each give rise to conceptualizations.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: “Mahāmati!

original: de'i phyir shin tu legs par nyon la yid la gzung zhig dang / ngas khyod la ji ltar mu stegs can rnams mya ngan las 'das par rnam par rtog pa dang / de dag gi rnam par rtog pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i rjes su mthun par 'gyur ba ma yin pa bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir shin tu legs par nyon la yid la gzung zhig dang / ngas khyod la ji ltar mu stegs can rnams mya ngan las 'das par rnam par rtog pa dang / de dag gi rnam par rtog pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i rjes su mthun par 'gyur ba ma yin pa bshad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, listen very well and keep it in mind! I will explain to you how the tīrthikas conceive of nirvāṇa and how their conceptions do not accord with nirvāṇa.

original: blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
analyzed: blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
translated: Mahāmati requested the Bhagavān,🔽“So be it.”

original: de bzhin du 'tshal lo zhes bka' mnyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'tshal lo zhes bka' mnyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Bhagavān said this:

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: “Mahāmati,

original: mu stegs can kha cig ni @417a *//
analyzed: mu stegs can kha cig ni @417a *//
translated: some tīrthikas

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams 'gags pa dang / yul 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / chos rnams mi rtag par mthong ba dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos kyi phyogs mi skye ba dang / 'das pa dang /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams 'gags pa dang / yul 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / chos rnams mi rtag par mthong ba dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos kyi phyogs mi skye ba dang / 'das pa dang /
translated: see the aggregates, elements, and sense bases cease, are free from desire for objects, see phenomena as impermanent, and the side of the mind and mental factors is unborn.

original: ma 'ongs pa dang / de ltar gyi yul mi dran pa dang / nye bar len pa phung po zad pa mar me bzhin 'gags pa dang / sa bon ltar zhig pas rnam par rtog pa mi skye'o zhes de dag gis 'di dag la mya ngan las 'das par 'du shes te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang / de ltar gyi yul mi dran pa dang / nye bar len pa phung po zad pa mar me bzhin 'gags pa dang / sa bon ltar zhig pas rnam par rtog pa mi skye'o zhes de dag gis 'di dag la mya ngan las 'das par 'du shes te /
translated: The past is not remembered, the future is not anticipated, and the present does not arise due to the exhaustion of the appropriated aggregates, like a flame extinguished, or like a seed destroyed.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: 'jig par lta ba la mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig par lta ba la mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: the view of annihilation is not called nirvāṇa.

original: kha cig ni phyogs nas phyogs su song na thar pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: kha cig ni phyogs nas phyogs su song na thar pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Some say that liberation is going from one direction to another.

original: kha cig ni yul gyi rtog pa 'gags te; ji ltar rlung zhi ba bzhin du gyur na thar pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: kha cig ni yul gyi rtog pa 'gags te; ji ltar rlung zhi ba bzhin du gyur na thar pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Some say that liberation is the cessation of conceptualization of objects, like the stilling of the wind.

original: kha cig ni blo dang rig par bya ba mthong ba rnam par zhig pa la thar pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: kha cig ni blo dang rig par bya ba mthong ba rnam par zhig pa la thar pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Some say that liberation is the destruction of the perception of the objects of cognition.

original: kha cig ni rtag pa dang / mi rtag par mthong ba la thar pa'o zhes 'du shes so //
analyzed: kha cig ni rtag pa dang / mi rtag par mthong ba la thar pa'o zhes 'du shes so //
translated: Some conceive of liberation as the view of permanence and impermanence.

original: kha cig ni mtshan mar 'du shes pa mang po ni sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i rgyu 'thob par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: kha cig ni mtshan mar 'du shes pa mang po ni sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i rgyu 'thob par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas /
translated: Some, thinking that the many discriminations of signs are the cause for the attainment of suffering,

original: rang gi sems snang ba tsam la mi mkhas pas mtshan ma rnams kyis 'jigs shing skrag ste /
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba tsam la mi mkhas pas mtshan ma rnams kyis 'jigs shing skrag ste /
translated: are frightened and terrified by signs, not skilled in the mere appearance of their own minds.

original: mtshan ma med par mthong ba la rab tu mos shing @417b 'dod nas mya ngan las 'das par 'du shes so //
analyzed: mtshan ma med par mthong ba la rab tu mos shing @417b 'dod nas mya ngan las 'das par 'du shes so //
translated: They aspire to and desire the vision of signlessness, and imagine that to be nirvana.

original: kha cig ni nang dang phyi'i chos thams cad kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid khong du chud pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba ni dngos por yod de /
analyzed: kha cig ni nang dang phyi'i chos thams cad kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid khong du chud pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba ni dngos por yod de /
translated: Some, having understood the general and specific characteristics of all inner and outer phenomena, and that the past, future, and present exist as things,

original: mi 'jigs pa'o zhes mya ngan las 'das par shes so //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa'o zhes mya ngan las 'das par shes so //
translated: imagine that to be nirvana.

original: kha cig ni bdag dang gang zag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / chos thams cad mi 'jig pa la mya ngan las 'das par 'du shes so //
analyzed: kha cig ni bdag dang gang zag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / chos thams cad mi 'jig pa la mya ngan las 'das par 'du shes so //
translated: Some imagine that the non-destruction of the self, person, sentient being, and life-force, and all phenomena, is nirvana.

original: mu stegs can kha cig ni log pa'i mes shes rab bsreg pa dang / rang bzhin dang skyes bu mthong zhing /
analyzed: mu stegs can kha cig ni log pa'i mes shes rab bsreg pa dang / rang bzhin dang skyes bu mthong zhing /
translated: Some tīrthikas burn their wisdom with the fire of wrong views and see the self and the person.

original: de gnyis kyi yod pa las skyes bus 'byin pa rnams ni rang bzhin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi yod pa las skyes bus 'byin pa rnams ni rang bzhin zhes bya ste /
translated: They say that the existence of those two is called “nature,”

original: ji ltar dang po'i mun pa bzhin du yon tan rnam par 'gyur ba dang / yon tan gyi byed pa po la mya ngan las 'das par 'du shes so //
analyzed: ji ltar dang po'i mun pa bzhin du yon tan rnam par 'gyur ba dang / yon tan gyi byed pa po la mya ngan las 'das par 'du shes so //
translated: and they think that the transformation of qualities is like the darkness at the beginning of time, and that the agent of qualities is nirvana.

original: kha cig ni bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa zad pas /
analyzed: kha cig ni bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa zad pas /
translated: Some think that nirvana is the exhaustion of merit and demerit.

original: kha cig ni nyon mongs pa zad cing shes pas /
analyzed: kha cig ni nyon mongs pa zad cing shes pas /
translated: Some think that nirvana is the exhaustion of afflictions and the knowledge of them.

original: kha cig ni 'khor ba rnams dbang phyug gis yang dag par byas par mthong ba la mya ngan las 'das par 'du shes so //
analyzed: kha cig ni 'khor ba rnams dbang phyug gis yang dag par byas par mthong ba la mya ngan las 'das par 'du shes so //
translated: Some think that nirvana is the perception that the creator of cyclic existence is Īśvara.

original: kha cig 'khor ba rnams ni gcig gis gcig bskyed pas rgyu gzhan ci'ang med de /
analyzed: kha cig 'khor ba rnams ni gcig gis gcig bskyed pas rgyu gzhan ci'ang med de /
translated: Some think that cyclic existence is produced by one thing and that there is no other cause at all.

original: 'di ltar rgyu la mngon par zhen cing de gti mug pas khong du mi chud de /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu la mngon par zhen cing de gti mug pas khong du mi chud de /
translated: Thus, they cling to a cause and do not understand it because of their delusion.

original: khong du ma chud pa'i phyir mya @418a *//
analyzed: khong du ma chud pa'i phyir mya @418a *//
translated: Because they are not understood, they are called “the three ignorances.”🔽

original: ngan las 'das pa'o zhes 'du shes so //
analyzed: ngan las 'das pa'o zhes 'du shes so //
translated: because they have not understood it, they imagine it to be nirvana.

original: mu stegs can kha cig ni yang dag pa'i bden pa'i lam thob pa la mya ngan las 'das par 'du shes so //
analyzed: mu stegs can kha cig ni yang dag pa'i bden pa'i lam thob pa la mya ngan las 'das par 'du shes so //
translated: Some tīrthikas imagine nirvana to be the attainment of the path of true reality.

original: kha cig ni yon tan can dang / yon tan gyis bskyed pa la tshogs pa dang / gcig pa dang / tha dad pa dang / gnyis ka dang / gnyis ka ma yin par mthong ba ba la mya ngan las 'das par 'du shes so //
analyzed: kha cig ni yon tan can dang / yon tan gyis bskyed pa la tshogs pa dang / gcig pa dang / tha dad pa dang / gnyis ka dang / gnyis ka ma yin par mthong ba ba la mya ngan las 'das par 'du shes so //
translated: Some see the accumulation, the single nature, the difference, the duality, and the nonduality of the one who possesses the qualities and the qualities produced by him, and imagine that to be nirvana.

original: kha cig ni rang bzhin las byung bas rma bya'i rnam par bkra ba dang / rin po che sna tshogs kyi 'byung gnas dang / tsher ma rno ba la sogs pa lta bur dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin mthong nas mya ngan las 'das par 'du shes so //
analyzed: kha cig ni rang bzhin las byung bas rma bya'i rnam par bkra ba dang / rin po che sna tshogs kyi 'byung gnas dang / tsher ma rno ba la sogs pa lta bur dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin mthong nas mya ngan las 'das par 'du shes so //
translated: Some see the nature of things, like the colorful patterns on a peacock’s tail, the source of various jewels, and the sharpness of thorns, and so forth, to arise from intrinsic natures, and imagine that to be nirvana.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,🔽some, having understood the twenty-five existences to be reality,

original: kha cig ni srid pa nyi shu rtsa lnga de kho na nyid yin par khong du chud pas /
analyzed: kha cig ni srid pa nyi shu rtsa lnga de kho na nyid yin par khong du chud pas /
translated: imagine that to be nirvana.

original: kha cig ni rgyal po'i yul skyong ba dang / yon tan drug gi bstan pa 'dzin pas mya ngan las 'das par 'du shes so //
analyzed: kha cig ni rgyal po'i yul skyong ba dang / yon tan drug gi bstan pa 'dzin pas mya ngan las 'das par 'du shes so //
translated: Some, by governing the king’s realm and upholding the doctrine of the six qualities, conceive of nirvana.

original: kha cig ni byed pa po dus yin par mthong nas /
analyzed: kha cig ni byed pa po dus yin par mthong nas /
translated: Some, seeing time as the creator,

original: 'jig rten 'byung ba ni dus la rag las so zhes de ltar khong du chud pa las mya ngan las 'das par 'du shes so //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'byung ba ni dus la rag las so zhes de ltar khong du chud pa las mya ngan las 'das par 'du shes so //
translated: conceive of nirvana from understanding that the arising of the world depends on time.

original: kha cig ni dngos pos so //
analyzed: kha cig ni dngos pos so //
translated: Some, by means of existence,

original: kha cig ni dngos po med pas so //
analyzed: kha cig ni dngos po med pas so //
translated: some, by means of nonexistence,

original: kha cig ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa yongs su shes pas so //
analyzed: kha cig ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa yongs su shes pas so //
translated: some, by means of the understanding of existence and nonexistence,

original: kha cig ni dngos po'i rtog pa dang / mya ngan @418b las 'das pa bye brag yod par mthong bas mya ngan las 'das par 'du shes te /
analyzed: kha cig ni dngos po'i rtog pa dang / mya ngan @418b las 'das pa bye brag yod par mthong bas mya ngan las 'das par 'du shes te /
translated: and some, by seeing the difference between the concept of existence and nirvana, conceive of nirvana.

original: de ltar de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa sna tshogs mu stegs can dag gis bstan pa yod kyang rigs pa dang mi ldan pas mkhas pa rnams kyis spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa sna tshogs mu stegs can dag gis bstan pa yod kyang rigs pa dang mi ldan pas mkhas pa rnams kyis spangs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, although such various concepts are taught by the tīrthikas, they are rejected by the wise because they are illogical.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: de dag thams cad mtha' gnyis su lhung ba'i bsam pas mya ngan las 'das par 'du shes te /
analyzed: de dag thams cad mtha' gnyis su lhung ba'i bsam pas mya ngan las 'das par 'du shes te /
translated: All of them are conceptualized as nirvana by the thought that has fallen into the two extremes.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pas mu stegs can dag mya ngan las 'das par yongs su rtogs kyang /🔽'di la gang yang skye ba 'am /
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pas mu stegs can dag mya ngan las 'das par yongs su rtogs kyang / 'di la gang yang skye ba 'am /
translated: The tīrthikas conceptualize nirvana in this way and so on, but

original: 'gag pa med do //
analyzed: 'gag pa med do //
translated: here there is nothing that arises or🔽ceases.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: mu stegs can so so'i mya ngan las 'das pa de dag ni de dag rang gi bstan bcos dang shes pas so sor brtags pas na rnam par bzhag pa ci'ang med de; ji ltar de dag gi rnam par rtog pa'i sems dang / yid bzhin du 'ong ba dang /
analyzed: mu stegs can so so'i mya ngan las 'das pa de dag ni de dag rang gi bstan bcos dang shes pas so sor brtags pas na rnam par bzhag pa ci'ang med de; ji ltar de dag gi rnam par rtog pa'i sems dang / yid bzhin du 'ong ba dang /
translated: those tīrthikas’ individual nirvāṇas are not established at all by their own treatises and knowledge, because just as their conceptual mind and thought come and go and move about,🔽there is nothing whatsoever that attains nirvāṇa.

original: 'gro ba dang / rab tu g-yo bas thams cad gang yang mya ngan las 'das pa thong ba med do; ;blo gros chen po /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang / rab tu g-yo bas thams cad gang yang mya ngan las 'das pa thong ba med do; ;blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: ngas ji skad du bstan pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ngas ji skad du bstan pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: the nirvāṇa that I teach is as follows:

original: rang gi sems snang ba tsam du mkhas shing khong du chud pa dang / phyi rol gyi dngos po'i mngon par chags shing mtha' bzhi yongs su spangs pa dang / yang dag pa ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du mthong bas rang gi sems snang bar rnam par rtog pa'i mtha' gnyis @419a *//
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba tsam du mkhas shing khong du chud pa dang / phyi rol gyi dngos po'i mngon par chags shing mtha' bzhi yongs su spangs pa dang / yang dag pa ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du mthong bas rang gi sems snang bar rnam par rtog pa'i mtha' gnyis @419a *//
translated: They are skilled and understand that their minds are mere appearances, they are completely free from the four extremes with regard to external things, they see things as they are, and they do not fall into the two extremes of conceptualizing their minds as appearances.

original: su ma lhung ba dang / gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa mi dmigs pas tshad ma thams cad kyis grub par mi mthong ba dang / de kho na nyid la rmongs pa yin pas yongs su bsdu bar mi bya'o zhes de yongs su spangs nas /

translated: They do not see anything established by any valid cognition because they do not observe apprehended objects and apprehending subjects, and they do not gather disciples because they are confused about reality.

original: bdag gi 'phags pa'i so so rang gis rig pa'i chos thob pa dang / bdag med pa rnam gnyis rtogs pa dang / nyon mongs pa gnyis yongs su spangs pa dang / sgrib pa gnyis rnam par dag pa dang / 'chi 'pho gnyis gtan nas spangs pa dang /
analyzed: bdag gi 'phags pa'i so so rang gis rig pa'i chos thob pa dang / bdag med pa rnam gnyis rtogs pa dang / nyon mongs pa gnyis yongs su spangs pa dang / sgrib pa gnyis rnam par dag pa dang / 'chi 'pho gnyis gtan nas spangs pa dang /
translated: They abandon those and think, ‘I have attained the Dharma of the noble ones’ individual knowledge, I have realized the two kinds of no-self, I have abandoned the two defilements, I have purified the two obscurations, I have completely abandoned the two kinds of death and rebirth,

original: sa rnams gong nas gong du sbyangs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la 'jug cing gzugs brnyan dang / sgyu ma la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin zab mo thob pa dang / sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa yongs su spangs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sa rnams gong nas gong du sbyangs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la 'jug cing gzugs brnyan dang / sgyu ma la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin zab mo thob pa dang / sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa yongs su spangs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bstan to //
translated: Through training in the stages in ascending order, one enters the stage of the Tathāgatas, attains the profound samādhis such as the reflection and illusion samādhis, and abandons mind, thought, and mental consciousness. This is taught to be nirvāṇa.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /

analyzed: de la khyod dang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan dag gis bslab par bya zhing /

analyzed: byis pa dag gis gnyis mod mthong //
